title: Internship- Environmental, Health & Safety
description:
ASML US brings together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, the Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon


ASML Wilton is seeking a highly-motivated intern who will work with and support Environmental Health & Safety (EH&S) personnel. This individual will have the opportunity to become an instrumental part of the daily EH&S activities which support both the Manufacturing and Development and Engineering (D&E) operations to assist in the development and implementation of Workplace Health & Safety Programs. This individual will participate in the performance of assignments, spend time shadowing EH&S personnel, and have unique assignments that support larger projects as well as experience the day-to-day workings of EH&S. This includes daily walk throughs, risk assessments, audits, incident investigations, training sessions, IH activities and much more. They may perform and/or participate in additional activities/events which help them build a strong network within ASML and with fellow interns. With the committed support of ASML Wilton and ASML Corporate Management, promotes a culture focused on safety and injury prevention to maintain and implement best practices for a comprehensive EH&S Management System.

**Responsibilities**

* Improve workplace performance by promoting an incident-free workplace, identifying and mitigating risks and implementing corrective actions.
* Assist/support the Wilton EH&S Department on a daily basis.
* Assist/support in incident investigations, development of root cause analysis, and identify corrective actions.
* Assist/support with risk assessments (JSA, ergonomic assessments, etc.) as needed to reduce workplace injuries. Assist/support in audits, report findings, and assist in development of corrective actions.
* Assist/support in development and delivery of workplace EH&S trainings.
* Assist/support with special projects. Data collection and analysis.
* Conduct business with the highest ethical standards and demonstrate decision-making skills that ensure the safety of all persons associated with ASML operations.
* Other relevant duties as assigned.

**Internship Eligibility and Education Requirements**

* Must be enrolled in college/university taking at least one class in the semester (spring/fall) prior to participation in the program and then shall return to college/university for at least one semester after completion of this program.
* Undergraduate or Master’s degree, preferably in Environmental/Occupational Health & Safety or Safety, Security, Emergency Management.
* Knowledge and understanding of Federal OSHA, State, and Local safety regulations.

**Skills**


Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.


To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

* Can observe and respond to people and situations and interact with others encountered in the course of work.
* Can learn and apply new information or skills.
* Must be able to read and interpret data, information, and documents.
* Strong customer focus and commitment to customer satisfaction through prioritization, quality, efficiency and professionalism.
* Ability to complete assignments with attention to detail and high degree of accuracy.
* Proven ability to perform effectively in a demanding environment with changing workloads and deadlines.
* Result driven-demonstrate ownership and accountability.
* Identifies bottlenecks and drives improvements.
* Work independently or as part of a team and follow through on assignments with minimal supervision.
* Demonstrate open, clear, concise and professional communication.
* Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with manager, co-workers and customer.
* Work according to a strict set of procedures within the provided timelines.

**Role within the Factory**

**Responsibilities:**

* Must be willing to work in a clean room environment, wearing coveralls, hoods, booties, safety glasses and gloves for entire duration of shift.
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee routinely is required to sit; walk; talk; hear; use hands to keyboard, finger, handle, and feel; stoop, kneel, crouch, twist, reach, and stretch.
* The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
* Can work under deadlines.
* The environment generally is moderate in temperature with moderate to high noise level.
* Must be willing to work a compressed work week schedule- twelve-hour long shift and rotating from three to four days a week.
* This must include references to day and night shifts for accommodation purposes.

**Additional responsibilities for Wilton Factory:**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* While performing the duties of this job, the employee routinely is required to sit; walk; talk; hear; use hands to keyboard, finger, handle, and feel; stoop, kneel, crouch, twist, reach, and stretch.
* The employee is required to work in a cleanroom environment: full gowning (full body coveralls, hood, CR safety shoes, face mask, nitrile gloves and safety glasses. Working under ISO 9000/14000 standards).
* Operating/working around overhead cranes, fork trucks and motorized pallet movers.
* Working around lasers; working with ladders; working on platforms; and working around chemicals.
* The employee is occasionally required to move around the campus.
* The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds.
* May require travel dependent on company needs.
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus

*This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.*

**Diversity and inclusion**
---------------------------


ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.


Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions.

**Request an Accommodation**
----------------------------


ASML provides reasonable accommodations to applicants for ASML employment and ASML employees with disabilities. An accommodation is a change in work rules, facilities, or conditions which enable an individual with a disability to apply for a job, perform the essential functions of a job, and/or enjoy equal access to the benefits and privileges of employment. If you are in need of an accommodation to complete an application, participate in an interview, or otherwise participate in the employee pre-selection process, please send an email to**USHR\\_Accommodation@asml.com** to initiate the company’s reasonable accommodation process.

*Please note: This email address is solely intended to provide a method for applicants to initiate ASML’s process to request accommodation(s). Any recruitment questions should be directed to the designated Talent Acquisition member for the position.*

title: Bilingual ESL Instructor for Adults Learning English
description:
We are looking for enthusiastic teachers to motivate and prepare our students to achieve their goals by developing effective English communication skills. Lift and inspire others by planning and delivering high-quality, creative, and engaging lessons for diverse groups learning English as a Second Language (ESL). Training provided.

About UCEDA Institute:

UCEDA Institute began in 1988 with a simple idea to empower students through mastery of the English language. Today we've evolved into a chain of schools with many locations and branches in popular areas throughout the United States. For millions of individuals throughout the world, English continues to serve as a bridge to greater possibilities and success. We are proud to continue guiding ambitious students towards their goals, and we invite you to join us.

UCEDA Institute has an immediate Part-Time opportunity for an Adult ESL Instructor in New Brunswick, NJ.

**Tentative schedule: Monday through Thursday 8am-12:30pm and/or 5:30pm-10pm.**

-Prepare lesson plans and deliver quality classroom instruction by following the standard UCEDA class format and using UCEDA materials.

- Apply a developmental approach to learning, coaching students according to their individual development needs, and encouraging self-expression leading to a successful student experience.

- Play an active role in helping students persist toward their goals by closely monitoring students' attendance and performance, addressing issues appropriately, and following proper procedures in tutoring, homework, etc.

- Report students' academic progress periodically to ensure they are mastering the skills on a regular basis.

- Use a variety of activities and instructional methods (songs, stories, media, structured games etc.) to motivate and stimulate students.

- Cooperate with the School Manager and other administrative staff.

- Attend training sessions and seminars provided by UCEDA leadership.

- Set a positive example of compliance with school policies.

Required Qualifications:

- Bilingual speaker preferred (English/Spanish).

- Experience applying a structured approach to teaching, training, coaching, and/or motivating others to achieve their goals.

- High level of common-sense: Able to connect with others, identify and respond to behavioral trends, adapt quickly to circumstances, and interpret non-verbal communication cues.

- Strong interpersonal skills and experience dealing with people of many cultures, showing an appropriate level of respect and cultural sensitivity.

- Motivated, creative, organized, patient, flexible, enthusiastic about others' success.

- Strong understanding of grammar, excellent written and verbal communication skills required.

- Bachelor's degree required.

- CELTA, TEFL, TESL, or other formal training in ESL teaching strongly preferred.

Don't miss this opportunity to start or continue your career in the Education industry. UCEDA thrives on promoting within and offers constant training and professional development with growing responsibilities. Not only will you be growing professionally and as an individual, you will also be providing many students with an opportunity to improve their lives tremendously through the education they receive.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $26.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Teaching: 1 year (Preferred)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)
* any other language (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* TESL/TEFL Certification (Preferred)

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Preferred)
* Night Shift (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* New Brunswick, NJ 08901 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Casual Staff - ITS Content Administrator
description:
**Casual Staff - ITS Content Administrator**  

**Job No:** 497773  

**Work Type:** Staff Part-time, Temporary and/or Hourly  

**Department:** Information Technology Services  

**Location:** Wilf Campus, 500 West 185th Street, NY, NY  

**Categories:** Information Technology  

  

Position Summary:
  

  

The ITS Part-Time Content Administrator updates and maintains ITS' Teams/SharePoint and website presence. The successful candidate collaborates with ITS functional disciplines and other departments to ensure up-to-date, relevant, and optimally functioning internal websites. The candidate will develop a sensible taxonomy for ITS topics and disciplines and apply them to existing data sets.  

  

This is a part-time position with an expected workload of approximately 5 hours/week.  

  

Position Responsibilities:  

* Update and maintain ITS's SharePoint and website presence
* Develop appropriate taxonomy for ITS topics and apply it to existing and new data sets
  

  

  

Experience & Educational Background:  

* Associate's degree in IT related Field
* 1-2 years of professional work within an IT environment
  

  

  

Skills & Competencies:  

* Knowledge of IT Infrastructure and Application topics within an educational environment
* Experience with creating and maintaining MSFT SharePoint/Teams
* Experience with MS Office Suite
* Experience managing an email inbox and collaboration tools
* Experience with website administration preferred
  

  

  

Salary Range:  

  

$45.00 - $55.00 per hour  

  

About Us:
  

  

Founded in 1886, Yeshiva University (YU) has a strong tradition of combining Jewish scholarship with academic excellence and achievement in the liberal arts, sciences, medicine, law, business, social work, Jewish studies, education, psychology, and more.
  

  

We are a leading global educational institution that employs 2,000 people across our various campus locations - Wilf Campus, Beren Campus, Brookdale Center, Resnick Campus in the Bronx, the Gruss Institute in Jerusalem, the Boys High School in Manhattan, and the Girls High School in Queens. From the distinguished faculty who teach here, to the dedicated staff, we work to fulfill our mission through all that we teach, by all that we do, and for all those we serve. We seek to attract and retain engaged and committed individuals who contribute to an exciting working environment, where there is a sense of community and belonging, balanced with a significant cross-section of people from diverse backgrounds working and studying together.  

  

The University offers an excellent compensation package, and a broad range of employee benefit plans, including immediate participation in the University's retirement plan. Staff members are typically eligible for four weeks of paid vacation each year and have access to a shuttle to nearby subway locations.  

  

Equal Employment Opportunity:
  

  

Yeshiva University is an equal-opportunity employer committed to hiring minorities, women, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans.  

  

**Application Instructions:**  

  

To apply, visit https://careers.pageuppeople.com/876/cw/en-us/job/497773/casual-staff-its-content-administrator  

  

*Yeshiva University is an equal-opportunity employer committed to hiring minorities, women, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans.*

title: Associate Director of Admission Operations
description:
**Associate Director of Admission Operations**  

Yeshiva University, in partnership with the national search firm Scott Healy & Associates, invites applications and nominations for the position of **Associate Director of Admission Operations** in the Katz School of Science and Health. Yeshiva University seeks a collaborative, collegial and leader who is committed to a high-quality student experience. The ideal candidate will be highly skilled in training others, bring a service-oriented approach to the role, and maintain a strong focus on integrity and doing what is right.  

  

The Associate Director of Admission Operations focuses on the developing and maintaining a comprehensive knowledge of University CRM systems including import and export of datasets, applications, forms, building views, fields, and creating reports and analyses for various stakeholders. This position plays a primary role in CRM customization, enrollment communication automation, and CRM training for staff, to support the enrollment goals of Katz School.  

  

**Responsibilities:**  

Serves as the subject matter expert in data management between University CRMs, including Recruit, CAS, HubSpot, and external platforms, such as testing or foreign credential evaluation agency portals.  

Optimizes CRM systems to support the core functions of application processing, recruitment, yield campaigns, and enrollment forecasting.
  

Maintains data integrity of the admissions database and ensures data accuracy by developing methods to check and correct discrepancies.  

Configures CRM systems to support events, such as webinars and open houses in planning, communication, tracking and reporting.
  

Collects data metrics regarding communication plans and student response rates to include email, text, and phone calls to identify future needs  

Monitors call center workflow and runs analytics
  

Assigns workload tasks regarding stage, territory and workload to ensure efficiency.
  

Contributes to the growth and modification of University CRM and Admissions operations by acquiring and maintaining knowledge of new and emerging resources and tools that can assist in advancing the office initiatives.  

Develops standard practices, training guides, and reference materials for new users. Provides ongoing training and quality control for all users.  

Collaborates with the admissions team to participate in recruitment and yield events
  

Review applications during peak times  

Other tasks as assigned
  

  

**Required Qualifications:**  

Bachelor's degree
  

At least 3 years of progressive work experience in enrollment management or related fields
  

Advanced knowledge in CRM management systems including Recruit or Slate, HubSpot and Banner  

Advanced knowledge in data analytics and visualization platforms, including Tableau or Microsoft Power BI, and Microsoft Excel  

Outstanding organizational and communications skills  

Ability to manage competing and changing priorities
  

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**  

Master's degree in a related field highly preferred  

Demonstrated skills in computer scripting and functional programming  

Demonstrated knowledge of STEM programs, current trends, job outcomes, and verbiage for the disciplines  

  

**About US:**  

Yeshiva University, located in the heart of New York City, is a US News and World Report Top 100 University.  

  

The Katz School of Science and Health is Yeshiva University's flagship school for STEM. We are research scientists, tech builders and patient-centered clinicians working on problems that matter. We focus on industry sectors that are central to the modern economy: Artificial Intelligence, Biotechnology, Cybersecurity, Data Analytics, Digital Media, and Fintech, as well as Nursing, Occupational Therapy, Physician Assistant Studies and Speech-Language Pathology.
  

  

Katz School faculty take an interdisciplinary approach to research and education, fostering the creativity, collaborative thinking and builder mindset required to take on today's toughest problems. Over the last five years, we have launched ten master's and doctoral programs with 92% graduation rates, 100% licensure pass rates, 95% post-graduation employment in high-paying careers, and students and alumni from over 30 countries.
  

  

The Katz School is a close-knit community with a big network, nestled in the heart of a big city. We are global in reach, with faculty and students from across the United States and around the world-and also deeply embedded in New York City's rich professional and social fabric. With a vibrant campus life and city at our fingertips, the Katz School is where bold, purpose-driven people come to create, connect and explore. Read about the research projects at Katz.
  

  

**3 Campuses:**  

  

Beren Campus-Main  

32nd St. and Lexington Ave., New York, NY  

Home to the Katz School's STEM and Speech-Language Pathology programs, the Beren Campus is in the heart of midtown Manhattan, just two blocks from the Empire State Building.
  

  

Beren Campus-Nursing  

41ST St. and 2nd Ave., New York, NY  

The Katz School's Nursing programs meet in a state-of-the-art facility five minutes from Grand Central Station and blocks away from some of the city's best hospitals and clinics.  

  

Jack and Perl Resnik Campus  

1300 Morris Park Ave. and 1165 Morris Park Ave., Bronx, NY  

The Katz School's Occupational Therapy and Physician Assistant programs are housed on a lush green campus in the Bronx, surrounded by hospitals, clinics and the Albert Einstein College of Medicine.
  

  

**Application and Nomination Process:**  

All correspondence relating to the position of Associate Director of Admission Operations at Yeshiva University should be directed in confidence to the University's executive search consultant:  

  

**Christopher Healy, President**  

**Scott Healy & Associates**  

chris@scotthealy.com
  

  

A complete application should include the following:  

  

1. Cover Letter outlining your interest and qualifications for the position;  

2. Updated CV;  

3. Three (3) professional references with contact information, title, institutional affiliation, email address and direct phone numbers. (No references will be contacted without written permission from the candidate.)  

  

Applications received by October 31, 2024 will receive priority consideration. The search will remain open until the position is filled.  

  

Salary Range: $82.5k-$90K  

  

*Yeshiva University is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring minorities, women, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.*

title: IT Technician
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented ICT Technician to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in network infrastructure, with hands-on experience in the programming and maintenance of CCTV systems, access control, VOIP phone solutions and other telecommunications technologies. This role requires a solid understanding of networking principles, protocols, and best practices.

**Key Responsibilities:**

Set up all programming and network infrastructure of CCTV installations, ensuring optimal coverage and functionality.

Implement access control systems, including network related hardware and software components.

Install and configure VOIP phone solutions, ensuring seamless integration with existing systems.

**Technical Support:**

Provide technical support for network-related issues, troubleshooting IP connectivity, port forwarding, and firewall configurations.

Maintain accurate documentation of network configurations, installations, and maintenance activities.

Generate reports on system performance and provide recommendations for improvements.

Collaboration:

Work closely with other IT team members and service technicians to enhance overall service delivery and performance.

Assist in training junior staff on network infrastructure and telecommunications best practices.

**Experience:**

Minimum of 3 years of experience in IT support with a focus on network infrastructure and telecommunications.

Proven experience with VOIP installations, CCTV systems, and access control solutions.

**Technical Skills:**

Strong understanding of IP addressing, routing protocols, and networking fundamentals.

Proficient in port forwarding, firewall management, and network security best practices.

Familiarity with fiber backbone installation as well as structured cabling.

**Certifications:**

Relevant certifications (e.g., CompTIA Network+, Cisco CCNA, etc.) are a plus.

**Soft Skills:**

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Strong communication skills to effectively interact with clients and team members.

Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.

\\*\\*\\*Salary based on experiance \\*\\*\\*

If you are passionate about technology and eager to contribute to a collaborative team environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity as an IT Technician.

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Home Care Marketer
description:

**Identify, evaluate, and prioritize potential referral sources within the agency’s**

**territory - Develop and execute a comprehensive outreach plan to increase**

**awareness and drive engagement with a variety of referral sources.**

**The plan should include specific strategies and tactics to reach different referral**

**sources with appropriate and tailored activities - Establish and maintain strong**

**business relationships with a variety of new and existing referral sources .**

**- Schedule and present information about Home care programs and services to the**

**community organizations, including doctors’ offices, hospitals, medical centers,**

**senior centers, rehabilitation facilities, and other healthcare professionals in order**

**to reach eligible home care patients .**

**- Demonstrate a thorough and complete knowledge of the agency including our**

**vision, mission and values; the services we provide; and how we differentiate**

**ourselves from other home care agencies .**

**- Research and participate in marketing and networking events, health and**

**wellness fairs, community events throughout New York City to enhance visibility of**

**agency services in the community and generate new relationships and business.**

**- Prepare an annual budget for outreach activities**

**- Provide monthly reports on outreach efforts.**

**Ability to travel within five boroughs of New York City 5 days a week.**

**Expected start of cares within first 3 months.**

**Previous health care marketing experience; Home Care preferred Existing contacts**

**and territorial knowledge of local area and referral sources Be self-driven, positive,**

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
**Position Overview:**



The B2B Digital Marketing Specialist is a results-driven marketing professional who will execute digital marketing tactics to build brand equity and support lead generation. If you are self-motivated, eager to take on multiple, diverse challenges, and looking for an opportunity where you can grow – HomeServe is for you!



We are looking for a creative talent to join our B2B Marketing Team who is comfortable deploying content across multiple channels including events, email, website, and social media. Each of our employees has a significant impact on our company and our culture – we want to hire superstars to make our work exceptional, our office fun, and our prospects, partners and customers delighted!

  


**Responsibilities:**


* Assist in the planning and execution of digital marketing campaigns across various channels, including events, email, website, and social media.
* Manage content on digital platforms, including blog posts, case studies, newsletters, social media updates, and paid ads.
* Contribute to lead generation efforts by optimizing landing pages, supporting lead nurturing workflows, and ensuring proper CRM integration.
* General web updates and coordinating with external vendors as needed.
* Monitor and report on digital marketing performance
* Provide administrative support for marketing initiatives, including maintaining marketing calendars, tracking budgets, and managing project timelines

  


**Essential Functions:**



**Essential Job Function**

  

**% of Time on Function**

  


**Campaign Support**

**25%**

  


**Content Assistance**

  

**25%**

  


**Lead Generation**

  

**25%**

  


**Analytics Support**

**15%**

  


**Administrative Support**

**10%**

  


**Total**

**100%**

  


**Job Requirements:**


* Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, communications, or a related field.
* 3-5 years of experience in digital marketing within a B2B context. Proven success in digital campaigns and lead generation.
* Knowledge of digital marketing platforms/marketing automation tools; Word Press, HubSpot, Zoom and Salesforce experience.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a specific focus on B2B marketing email communications, website applications
* Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Access)
* Employs a grow mindset.
* Strategic and innovative thinker with a creative approach to solving challenges.
* Meticulous, results-driven, and able to work collaboratively in a cross functional setting.
* Proactive and capable of driving initiatives with minimal supervision.

  


**Minimum Physical Requirements:**



The physical demands described represent those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions of the position for which they work. While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to listen, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands or fingers, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls while executing tasks like working on a computer or talking on the telephone. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to low.

  



Salary Range: $65,643.18 - $87,524.25



Annual Bonus Potential: 5%

title: Tunnel Inspection Team Leader
description:
**Job Description**

**GMS** is seeking a **Tunnel Inspection Team Leader** for our New York Office. The applicant should have proven effectiveness performing tunnel and/or bridge condition assessments. Strong knowledge of bridge and/or tunnel inspection standards and field inspection experience is essential. This position is full-time and will be in-person in the office (and inspection sites) five days per week.

GMS encourages employees to become registered professional Engineers and Architects. We also encourage Engineers and Architects at all levels to obtain relevant certifications. Membership in professional societies and the writing of professional papers are supported by the firm.

GMS encourages the professional growth of its staff. There are presently 11 Partners in the company in which three of the Partners were hired by GMS directly after college. Our employee development and evaluations systems base our promotions on performance, skills, and potential of the candidate.

**Roles & Responsibilities**

Tunnel Inspection Team Leader responsibilities include:

* Perform structural condition inspections of existing Tunnel structures and associated tunnel facility structures in accordance with TOMIE (Tunnel Operations, Maintenance, Inspection, and Evaluation) manual chapters 4 and 5, as well as current ACI and/or AISC standards as applicable.
* Prepare clear and concise inspection reports, for submission to government agencies, including recommendations for repair/rehabilitation
* Lead inspection teams; train and supervise assistant team leaders.
* Coordinate and schedule field activity associated with inspections, including coordination with facility owner/agency and third-party contractors.
* This role requires mandatory random drug/alcohol testing.

**Education and Experience Requirements/Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s or master’s degree from an accredited engineering program
* At least five (5) years of consistent experience in the field of structural engineering and construction
* Registered Professional Engineer in New York, preferred
* Certified as a Team Leader in accordance with the National Tunnel Inspection Standards, 23 CFR Part 650, § 650.509 (b) or shall become certified as a Team Leader by successfully completing the FHWA-NHI-130110 Tunnel Safety Inspection training course Tunnel or bridge condition inspection experience with the ability to identify and evaluate defects that diminish the integrity of a structural member
* Design experience and familiarity with the type of civil/structural systems installed in tunnels
* Ability to assess the degree of deterioration for concrete, steel, masonry, and timber materials
* Understanding of the applicable codes and guidelines for structural systems.

**Talent/Skills**

The ideal candidate should have a solid understanding of construction materials, structural systems, and inspection procedures. They must be familiar with building codes and safety regulations, ensuring that all inspections meet industry standards. Excellent attention to detail and strong observational skills are crucial for identifying structural issues. Effective communication is essential for reporting findings and working collaboratively with project teams. The candidate should be able to work independently on-site and manage time efficiently. Proficiency with inspection tools, testing equipment, and software for report documentation is also required.

**About GMS**

GMS is a multi-disciplinary, Structural Engineering and Architecture consulting firm headquartered in New York City, with offices in Los Angeles, California, New Jersey, and Connecticut. We take great pride in our expertise – please visit our website to see what we do. Since our inception in 1991, GMS has won over 400 project awards and has had the privilege of working with many talented engineers and architects, including ten Pritzker Prize winners. GMS has won four (4) AISC Ideas2 awards and has been a national finalist four times for design of innovative steel projects.

Join our team! Celebrating 33 years of service, GMS is proud to have won hundreds of awards and honored to have collaborated with a wide array of excellent architects, owners, builders, corporations, designers, and artists, including ten Pritzker prize laureates on twenty-four different projects and studies.

We believe that providing a work environment grounded in excellence for our employees will translate directly into outstanding service for our Clients and the other members of the design/construction community.

GMS offers a competitive salary, a comprehensive benefits program, and a 401K retirement plan with a company match. GMS is an equal opportunity employer

Resumes and transcripts may be sent to employment@gmsllp.com with the job title in the subject line

title: Phlebotomist-Weekend only
description:
**At Labcorp we have a passion in helping people live happy and healthy lives. Every day we provide vital information that helps our clients and patients understand their health. If you are passionate about helping people and have a drive for service, then Labcorp could be a great next career step!**


We are currently seeking a Phlebotomist to work in either a Patient Service Center or Client office. In this role you will provide exceptional customer service, perform skilled specimen collections and be the face of the company. In addition, you will be provided opportunities for continuous growth within the organization.

For more detailed information, please** click here**.**

**implement patient care plans.**

**- Document patient information, including medical history, symptoms, and**

**treatment plans, in electronic health record systems.**

**setting.**

**conditions and promoting overall wellness.**

**- Assist with medical coding and billing processes to ensure accurate**

title: Intern - Creative Design
description:
**Company Overview:**

At Labcorp, we believe in the power of science to change lives. We are more than 60,000 people across 100 countries who are harnessing science for human good. Our work combines unparalleled diagnostic laboratories, drug development capabilities and commercial innovations. Together, we fuel scientific breakthroughs and deliver more than 160 million medical test results that help guide treatment decisions, accelerate patient care and change lives. Join us in our pursuit of answers.

**Global Internship Program:**

Exciting opportunity to be part of the Labcorp 2025 Global Internship Program as a **Creative Design Intern** in a **US-based fully-remote** position.


As a Labcorp intern, you will have the opportunity to support meaningful assignments that compliment an education in STEM+ Business and Healthcare disciplines and are inspiring and valuable in our mission to improve health and improve lives across the globe. In addition to department work, we support your professional development and career exploration through program workshops, leadership speakers, employee resource group introductions, new hire panel discussions and small group “coffee chats”.

**We offer paid internships for current students in a variety of degree programs, such as :**

* **Biological related sciences**
* **Chemistry related sciences**
* **Animal science**
* **Computer science**
* **Healthcare**
* **Business/marketing**

What you can expect as a Labcorp intern:

**In 2024, we hosted more than 250 internships globally. During your 12-week full-time assignment, you can expect:**

* **Project-based work**
* **Opportunities to build your network**
* **Mentoring and job shadowing**
* **Professional development workshops**
* **Hands-on experience**

Get ready to start your career and make a real difference for patients around the world. **#FutureofLabcorp**

**Position Overview:**


As a Creative Design Intern on the Brand Creative team at Labcorp, you’ll have the opportunity to take on a wide variety of graphic design projects, such as print/digital ads, video, and social media to spatial branding, presentations, and more. Reporting to a Creative Design Manager, you can showcase your eye for detail while maintaining a blend of creative and technical production skills. With unparalleled diagnostics and drug development capabilities, at Labcorp we accelerate innovation and provide insight to improve health and improve lives. You have the chance to create supporting visual and interactive designs that promote the company's vision and brand standards.

**Roles and Responsibilities:**

* Apply principles for composition, brand identity systems, color, typography, photography, iconography, and other ingredients appropriately to create innovative visual solutions that meet business and user needs.
* Perform within an existing design system/brand guidelines across all mediums with moderate design changes.
* Contribute to the creation of new design systems with creative direction.
* Assist in campaign material development for diagnostics and drug development serving multiple areas of focus (ex. Oncology, Genetics, Women’s’ Health, Neurology to name a few).
* Manage time, multi-task, and work efficiently in tight timelines.
* Work well within a fast-paced customer centric environment and with a variety of stakeholders.
* Support content creation for print and digital marketing, including omni-channel marketing experiences.

**Qualifications and Education:**

* Junior or Senior college or university student majoring in Graphic Design, Communication Design, Visual Design or similar
* Design portfolio of student work samples

title: Facebook Ads Media Buyer
description:
**Perfect Selection Marketing**

**Facebook Ads Media Buyer**

**Location: New York, NY**

Job Description: We are looking for an experienced and highly skilled Facebook Ads Media Buyer to join our team on a contract basis. As a Facebook Ads Media Buyer, you will be responsible for managing and optimizing Facebook Ads campaigns for our marketing agency, PSM, as well as our clients. Your expertise in Facebook Ads will be instrumental in driving successful advertising campaigns and achieving our clients' marketing goals.

Responsibilities:

* Develop and implement effective Facebook Ads strategies and campaigns for PSM and client accounts.
* Conduct keyword research, ad copy creation, and targeting optimization to maximize campaign performance.
* Monitor and analyze campaign data, making data-driven decisions to improve campaign performance and achieve desired outcomes.
* Perform A/B testing to optimize ad creatives, landing pages, and other campaign elements.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to align Facebook Ads campaigns with overall marketing strategies and goals.
* Stay updated on the latest industry trends, Facebook Ads best practices, and algorithm changes.
* Track and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of campaigns and provide insights to clients.
* Monitor and manage campaign budgets effectively to maximize return on investment (ROI).
* Stay informed about industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging digital advertising technologies.

Requirements:

* Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Facebook Ads Media Buyer, with a proven track record of managing successful campaigns.
* In-depth knowledge of Facebook Ads platform, including campaign setup, optimization, and reporting.
* Proficiency in keyword research tools, ad copywriting, and ad performance analysis.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with clients and the internal team.
* Ability to manage multiple campaigns simultaneously and meet deadlines.
* Facebook Ads certifications are highly preferred.

**Compensation:** As a contractor, you will have the opportunity to negotiate your compensation based on your experience and expertise. We value the contributions of our contractors and aim to provide a fair and competitive compensation package.

**Working Hours:** As a contractor, you will have the flexibility to set your own working hours. We trust that you will manage your time effectively to meet project deadlines and client expectations.

Join our team at PSM and work as a Facebook Ads Media Buyer to drive the success of our agency and clients' advertising campaigns. If you are a self-motivated professional with a passion for digital advertising and a proven track record in managing Facebook Ads campaigns, we would love to hear from you.

To apply, please submit your resume, along with a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience in Facebook Ads and explaining why you would be a great fit for this role.

description:

**About us**

Dermatology Associate of Central NJ is a private dermatology practice. We have a very friendly and professional team of practitioners and staff. We’re looking for a professional who believes that patients should be treated as people rather than numbers in a file, and who understands the value of compassionate service.

**FRONT DESK MEDICAL RECEPTIONIST**

As we continue to grow, we are looking for new talent in 2023 to join our family & now is the perfect time to apply. Expanding Dermatology practice seeking an Experienced Front Desk Medical Receptionist to work with our team of medical dermatologists and physician assistants in a fast-paced environment. We have three convenient locations in Old Bridge, Freehold, & Union NJ. All new and state of the art! title: Warehouse Supervisor
description:
**Warehouse Specialist**

**Company Overview**

Advanced Warehouse Inc., is a full-service Third-Party-Logistics (3PL) service provider specializing in cosmetics, foodstuffs, clothing, and home goods. With locations in Central New Jersey and Southern California, AWI works strategically with retailers, startups, and established businesses to provide E-Commerce, Amazon FBA, big-box retailer distribution, and wholesale fulfillment, distribution, and transportation services with the backing of modern technology and our unique, boutique-like service level.

**Job Description**  
The Warehouse Supervisor is responsible for overseeing day-to-day warehouse operations, ensuring high productivity and stringent quality control. This role involves supervising staff, monitoring workflows, ensuring compliance with safety protocols, and meeting client-specific KPIs related to productivity, order accuracy, and service quality.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Team Management**

o Supervise, train, and assign tasks to warehouse personnel, ensuring the efficient use of labor resources.

o Provide regular feedback to staff to ensure productivity targets are met and quality standards are upheld.

**Operational Oversight**

o Oversee daily order picking, packing, shipping, receiving, and storage processes to meet operational efficiency and accuracy goals.

**Inventory & Quality Assurance Supervision**

o Supervise inventory control processes, including cycle counting and stock reconciliation, to maintain inventory accuracy.

o Ensure the proper handling, storage, and shipment of goods to avoid damage and meet client specifications.

**Productivity Supervision**

o Monitor staff performance to ensure productivity goals are met, such as orders picked and packed per hour.

o Use data from Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) to track performance and report on individual and team productivity levels.

**Quality Assurance Supervision**

o Supervise adherence to Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to ensure quality standards are consistently met.

**Client Service & Communication**

o Act as a point of contact for internal departments regarding client-specific requirements, ensuring clear communication of instructions to the warehouse team.

**Reporting & Analysis**

o Provide daily and weekly performance reports on productivity, order accuracy, and quality assurance to the Warehouse Manager.

o Participate in team meetings to provide feedback on operational performance and suggest improvements.

o Assist the Warehouse Manager in reviewing performance against KPIs and implementing corrective actions when needed.

**Qualifications**

* Proven experience in a warehouse supervisory role, preferably within a 3PL or logistics environment.
* Familiarity with Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) and basic IT skills for tracking inventory and performance metrics.
* Excellent organizational, multitasking, and leadership skills.
* English fluency required
* Spanish fluency preferred

**Work Conditions**

* Salary: Negotiable based on experience
* Full time On-Site Employment
* Location: Secaucus, NJ
* Hours: M-F, 8AM to 5PM

**Company Benefits**

* Health, Dental, Vision Insurance – 100% coverage for you and family
* Paid Time Off
* 401(K) with Company Match
* Free Daily Lunch Catering
* Annual performance-based incentives and bonus
* Fitness Center Membership Subsidy Program

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

Experience:

* 3PL: 2 years (Required)
* Warehouse management system: 2 years (Required)

* Spanish (Preferred)

title: Commando C# - FX Desk
description:
**Company Description**  

Talan is an international consulting group in innovation and transformation through technology. For 20 years, Talan has been advising companies and administrations. The group supports them and implements their transformation and innovation projects internationally.


Present on five continents, the group achieved a turnover of 600 million euros in 2023 than 5,000 consultants and aims to exceed the one billion € turnover mark by 2025. The group puts innovation at the heart of its development and intervenes in areas related to the technological changes of large groups, such as Artificial Intelligence, Data Intelligence, Web3, Metaverse, Blockchain or IoT.

 **Job Description**  

We are seeking a talented **Software Engineer** to join our team and work on **Foreign Exchange (FX) desk** projects. The ideal candidate will have expertise in **C#** and be passionate about **developing new features for their trading platforms.**

**Role and responsibilities**

* Understand key business requirements of FX, Rates Vanilla, and Exotic Products desks.
* Develop new tools and enhance existing ones, following commando standards (C# or Python backend, Excel front-end).
* Support trading tools (Excel/VBA and Python), including contribution, pricing, and risk & PnL spreadsheets.
* Collaborate closely with traders, providing daily support for trading tools.
* Work within a team of commandos to maintain and improve critical systems.
* Maintain strong communication and working relationships with the Front Office users.
* Exhibit autonomy and quick response to troubleshoot and resolve issues.


As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology and collaborate with a dynamic group of professionals who are dedicated to excellence. You will have the chance to contribute to the development of **our Finance engineering team** and grow your career in a stimulating environment.

 **Qualifications**  

* 3-4 years of experience as a Front Office developer working directly with traders.
* Strong proficiency in C# or Python for backend development and Excel/VBA for front-end trading tools.
* Familiarity with FX, Rates Vanilla, and Exotic Products desks.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to support Front Office users in a fast-paced environment.
* Highly reactive, with strong problem-solving skills and autonomy.
* Able to thrive in a team of commandos, working collaboratively to meet business needs.


The salary range for this role is US$70,000 - US$140,000

**Company’s Benefits**


At Talan, we invest in our employees' well-being and empower them with benefits, including:

* Competitive salary
* 401(k) retirement plan with company matching
* 15 days of paid vacation per year at hire and up to 27 according to seniority (annual untaken vacation days are cashed out)
* 8 paid holidays + 5 sick days + 2 personal days per year
* ❤️‍Company health, dental, and vision insurance plans + FSA
* Voluntary STD and LTD
* Commuter/transit benefits


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

 **Additional Information**  

C#, LINUX, FIX, multi-threading, , finance, low latency

title: After-school Assistant Site Director for Middle School
description:
Manhattan Youth is looking for a full-time After-school Assistant Site Director to join our dedicated team.

The Assistant Site Director is responsible for supporting the Program Director with the supervision and daily operations of their assigned after-school program and plays a critical role in Manhattan Youth’s ability to deliver high-quality after-school enrichment programs. Alongside the Program Director, Assistant Directors provide hands-on leadership and direction for after-school staff, engage in direct supervision of children, and collaborate with After-school teachers to develop age-appropriate curriculum, activities and projects across a range of areas including sports, arts, academic enrichment, and leadership. Daily job duties are divided between administrative responsibilities and on-site supervision of after-school programming.

This is an on-site, full-time non-exempt hourly position at an NYC public school located in Manhattan, following a Monday through Friday 10:30am-6:30pm schedule.
Key Responsibilities


* Conduct on-site and hands-on daily supervision (2-6pm) of Manhattan Youth’s age appropriate after-school activities (sports, arts, STEM and other academic enrichment, leadership)
* Assist in development of after-school curricula and special events
* Assist Program Director with hiring, training, evaluation and development of after-school staff
* Ensure safety of groups of children during classroom activities, recreation and field trips, address emergency situations and disciplinary issues, and maintain incidence logs
* Handle discipline issues for children and staff
* Maintain open and regular communication with school principal, faculty, PTA, staff, students and parents
* Lead weekly staff meetings and professional development trainings when necessary
* Manage after-school club enrollment, assignments and changes for participants, and track club attendance
* Coordinate program/staff schedules to meet needs of comprehensive after-school programming and DOE requirements and ensure coverage when staff members are absent
* Manage and track after-school equipment, consumables, supplies and snack inventory
* Perform all job-related duties as assigned and needed

  

  

Skills, Knowledge and Expertise


* 4-year university degree in education or a related field preferred, plus 3 years after-school, education and/or childcare experience
* Strong leadership skills and the ability to effectively manage and correct conduct and performance of adults and children
* Ability to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines and work under pressure
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Ability to maintain the confidentiality of all records
* Strong computer skills – including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, Sharepoint, OneDrive), Zoom, ATS, scheduling software
* Knowledge of or ability to master employee scheduling and newsletter applications
* Ability to take initiative, maintain tact and diplomacy, use sound judgment, anticipate issues and thoughtfully handle unanticipated events
* Strong analytical skills with meticulous attention to detail

  

  

Benefits


* Medical
* Dental
* Vision coverage
* Commuter benefits
* Generous PTO
* and a supportive and friendly environment!
About Manhattan Youth


Fostering Joy, Success & Belonging through Early Childhood, After School, Adult & Senior programming throughout New York City.  

Manhattan Youth Recreation and Resources, Inc. provides the highest quality childcare and After-School programs plus academic, recreational and cultural activities for children, families and individuals who live or work in Manhattan, regardless of income. We respond to the needs of our community through programs that stimulate, challenge and strengthen children, teens, adults, seniors, and families. We also engage in a number of civic issues that impact community life in Manhattan.
**Why Join Us**
At Manhattan Youth, we treat each other as we treat the children in our programs, with kindness, compassion and respect. We provide a fun, collaborative and nurturing environment that focuses on personal well-being and professional development. By joining our team, you are joining a group of people dedicated to improving the lives of the people in our community. We are looking for people with the same commitment to our mission and a desire to become part of a passionate and motivated team that genuinely gets along and loves what they do.
company_description: Manhattan Youth Recreation and Resources, Inc. provides the highest quality childcare and After-School programs.

title: RN or LPN - Pediatrics
description:
**Calling All Rockstar Nurses!**

Are you passionate about pediatrics and ready to make a real impact on the lives of children? We’ve got the perfect opportunity for you!

**About the Role**  
We’re on the lookout for a **superhero nurse** (cape optional) to join our team and ensure that all children in our UC program receive top-notch medical and dental care. You’ll be coordinating, monitoring, and documenting healthcare, collaborating with case managers, and making sure every child is on track with their health needs. Think of yourself as the guardian of their well-being – a real-life health champion!

The role entails working **Sunday through Thursday, 9 AM to 5 PM, on-site** for the first three months. After the probationary period, we’ll explore the possibility of transitioning to a hybrid role on the weekends.

Here’s what you’ll be up to:  
✔ Physical exams (doctor's orders, stat!)  
✔ Basic healthcare treatment  
✔ Tracking and scheduling health and dental check-ups (think of it as detective work, but for healthy smiles!)  
✔ Coordinating referrals and following up on specialist appointments  
✔ Ensuring that all prescribed medical treatments are followed (no slacking allowed!)

**Bonus Perks**

* You get to help educate our team and the children on health and safety issues, so you’ll always be in the know!
* You’ll be a key liaison between our program and community healthcare providers, helping to break down barriers and build bridges for the best care possible.
* Did we mention the **Well Care Clinic**? You’ll help run this, ensuring each session is smooth and effective.

**What You Bring to the Table**

* Graduate of an accredited Nurse Program (BA), licensed and registered (RN/LPN)
* 3+ years of nursing experience (pediatrics preferred)
* Strong computer skills (you’ll be Word, Excel, and PowerPoint savvy!)

**Ready to join a team that not only values your skills but puts them to work in a meaningful way?** Send your CV and let’s get the ball rolling. We can’t wait to see what a difference you’ll make!

P.S. If you’ve made it this far, we already like you. :)

title: Corporate Associate | New York, NY
description:
**Buzz About Us:**

Welcome to Hunt Hive Talent Recruiting Agency, where were all about connecting amazing talent with fantastic opportunities! Our mission? To help businesses and professionals soar to new heights. If you're ready for an adventure in the world of **Corporate M&A and Private Equity**, look no further. Join our vibrant team and be part of something extraordinary!

**About the Role:**

Were on the hunt for a **Corporate M&A and Private Equity Associate** to join our client's **corporate practice** in **New York** or **Boston**. The ideal candidate will have **3+ years of private equity transactional experience** and expertise in acquisitions, divestitures, mergers, joint ventures, and fund formation. If you're looking to take your career to the next level with a robust national practice that offers a clear path to partnership, we want to meet you!

**AM Law 100 Requirement:**

To be considered for this role, candidates must have recently worked at one of the **AM Law 100 firms**. To verify if your firm qualifies, please check this **AM Law 100 list**. Only candidates who have worked at these top firms will be considered for this opportunity.

**Your Mission:**

* Work on **acquisitions, divestitures, mergers, joint ventures**, and other private equity transactions.
* Provide legal services to **private equity funds**, **financial institutions**, and **global commingled funds**.
* Collaborate with a **national corporate team** to support complex corporate transactions.
* Manage transactions and work efficiently, both independently and within a team environment.
* Provide exceptional **client service**, ensuring that business goals are met through legal solutions.

**Core Competencies:**

* **Private Equity Transactional Expertise**: Strong experience handling private equity transactions, including mergers and acquisitions, fund formation, and portfolio management.
* **Corporate Legal Services**: Ability to advise on all aspects of commercial, financial, and industrial transactions.
* **Client-Centric Approach**: Commitment to delivering high-quality client service while managing complex corporate deals.
* **Communication & Collaboration**: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to work effectively in team settings.

**What You Bring:**

* **Juris Doctor (JD) or LLM** from an ABA-accredited law school.
* Admitted or eligible for admission in **New York** or **Massachusetts**.
* **3+ years of M&A and private equity transactional experience** in a corporate law firm.
* Strong organizational skills with **attention to detail**.
* Ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and balance competing responsibilities.

title: Worship Leader
description:
**Description:**  
Our Vision at New Life Church Is to create a culture that promotes Jesus Christ through Faith, Family, Fellowship and Successful Living and our mission is to Reach, Teach, Love and Serve.

We are a multi-cultural body of Christian believers. We are seeking a Worship Leader that will help us fulfill our vision and mission through music. The worship leader is critical in helping to grow and develop our praise team and leading those who attend our services in their worship to God

**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a talented Worship Leader to join our team. The ideal candidate will lead and inspire our congregation through music and worship.

**Responsibilities**

* Oversee Worship Ministry
* Conduct weekly rehearsals
* Grow Worship Ministry i.e. establish and conduct audition process for growing the department i.e. singers and musicians
* Coordinate the songs for Sunday services (mainly contemporary gospel mixed in with established oldies from time to time. The key is that all songs are biblically sound, and align with God’s word.
* Coordinate songs for special themed events, including but not limited to Resurrection Production, Christmas Production, Family and Friends Day, and Grandparents Day
* Provide weekly songs and lyrics to band and media team so they are prepared for services, and special and themed events.
* Additional duties as determined by the lead pastor and executive team when needed

**Qualities & Giftings:** 

* A sense of calling to Worship Ministry and can sing
* Ability to grow and develop a Worship Team
* Leadership skills & Communication skills

**Qualifications:**

* Has received Jesus Christ as Lord and Savior and is filled with the Holy Spirit
* 3+ years overseeing and leading a worship ministry

**Compensation:** 

* Pay will be commensurate with experience and is negotiable.
* Two weeks paid time off

**Please apply by doing the following:** 

* Email resume and references to info@newlifechurchnyc.org
* Provide a short statement of what led you to apply
* Share a sample of you leading worship, and any other samples of creative content that helps to know you better.

Job Type: Contract

* worship leader: 3 years (Required)

* New York, NY 10036 (Required)

title: Accounting Clerk
description:
Founded in 1958, Jonard Tools® manufactures tools for the Telecom, CATV, Fiber Optic, Home Automation, Security & Alarm, and Electrical markets. Jonard Tools designs and engineers patented products by utilizing customer partnerships to create innovative solutions for industry needs. New tools are released each month and are all Made For Life® with lifetime warranties. Through quality and innovation Jonard aims to move the industry forward and connect the world.

We are looking to hire an Accounting Clerk to join our team. This is a tremendous opportunity at a growing company. The ideal candidate will assist with various accounting tasks, ensuring accuracy and efficiency in financial operations.

* Maintain and update financial records, including ledgers and journals.
* Process invoices, receipts, and payments.

* Support month-end and year-end closing processes.
* Prepare financial reports as needed.
* Assist with audits and provide necessary documentation.
* Collaborate with team members to improve accounting and inventory processes.

* Associate degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field preferred; relevant experience will be considered.
* Previous experience in an accounting role is a plus.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel; experience with accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, SAP) is desirable.
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
* Ability to handle confidential information with discretion.

description:
Store Manager

Tempur Sealy is committed to improving the sleep of more people, every night, all around the world. As a leading designer, manufacturer, distributor, and retailer of bedding products worldwide, we know how crucial a good night of sleep is to overall health and wellness. Utilizing over a century of knowledge and industry-leading innovation, we deliver award-winning products that provide breakthrough sleep solutions to consumers in over 100 countries. Our highly recognized brands include Tempur-Pedic®, Sealy® and Stearns & Foster®. We hire people who have a passion for helping others find their best night’s sleep. No matter what stage of your career, you can build your future at Tempur Sealy!

**OUR COMPANY OFFERS GREAT BENEFITS, INCLUDING:**

* Generous Paid Time Off
* Competitive Medical, Dental & other wellness programs
* Disability and Life Company Paid
* Retirement Plan Options
* Generous Employee Purchase Discounts

Annual Base Pay Range (not including monthly production potential): $65,000-$75,000

The Store Manager will be instrumental in the recruitment, selection, and development of the retail stores team. This position requires a strong leader, extremely well organized, process oriented and quality minded individual that also possess the ability to bring people together in order to reach our common goal.

Essential Role Responsibilities:

* Provide overall store leadership, supervision, and delegation to store associates
* Drive brand awareness and brand advocacy to exceed projected store goals to include teaming up with partners in local market to raise awareness across the region
* Recruit, hire, and continued development of the store associates

title: Outreach Specialist
description:
**Position: Outreach Specialist**

**Location: New York City**

**Full-time, temporary contract, immediate hire**

**Our Work:**

Melissa Johnson Associates (MJA) is a woman-owned public relations firm specializing in community outreach and stakeholder engagement strategies. We are currently supporting the New York City Housing Authority (NYCHA) in conducting door-to-door canvassing on NYCHA households to ask a series of questions related to health and safety. To support this effort, MJA seeks to immediately contract with individuals who will provide temporary support to our team and boost our outreach efforts. This position is anticipated to be an on-the-ground Outreach Specialist, responsible for in-person site visits to NYCHA units. Candidates will report to MJA's NYCHA Outreach team.

**Responsibilities:**

MJA is seeking an outreach specialist for a temporary contract (3 months) out of our New York City office. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

* Conducting door-to-door outreach services at NYCHA units, using a data-gathering app (mobile device to be provided)
* Perform daily data entry tasks and maintain a log that documents when and which units were canvassed
* Participate in a paid onboarding session during their first contracted week
* Contractors will be required to use a cellular phone with access to data to log information gathered on unit’s survey through a digital form.
* Diligently document hours worked, units visited, and responses from residents

**Requirements:**

* Fluency in English, Spanish, Russian, or Chinese
* Preferred: NYCHA (New York City Housing Authority) resident
* Proficiency in filling out digital forms
* Must be able to work 40 hours/week on the ground (walking door to door, using staircases) at NYCHA developments
* Must be at least 18 years old and able to conduct site visits for an 8-hour duration (with lunch break)
* Excellent interpersonal skills and verbal/written communication skills
* Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
* Strong organization skills
* Experience working in similar areas and/or equivalent training in school, and background within related fields
* Willingness to work outside in all types of weather conditions
* Be comfortable working in-person, on the ground in NYCHA communities

**Compensation:**

$16 per hour (outreach staff) with possibility of promotion to supervisor at $18 per hour. Paid training will be provided for selected candidates.

**Application Details:**

This Door Knocker/Outreach Specialist position is an at-will position. Melissa Johnson Associates is an equal opportunity employer.

If you are passionate about making a difference in the community and have experience in outreach or related fields, we encourage you to apply. Join our team of dedicated professionals and help us create positive change!

title: Assistant Childcare Teacher
description:
*We are seeking a passionate and dedicated Assistant Teacher to join our team.*
  

  

At The Learning Experience, you can have the opportunity to create a positive and engaging learning environment for children, where "*happy happens here*" is not just a motto but a way of life. We are looking for someone committed to helping children learn, play, grow, and thrive and providing the tools they need to succeed academically and emotionally.  

  

If you are a caring and creative individual passionate about working with children, we encourage you to apply for this exciting Assistant Preschool Teacher opportunity.  

  

**This is an entry-level position.**  

  

**What We Offer:**  

  

* State-of-the-Art Classrooms: Our immersive classroom setting utilizes the latest technology, materials, and resources to allow children to "learn, play, and grow.”
* Opportunities for Growth: We offer ongoing training and professional development, tuition reimbursement, and leadership pathways to help you meet your goals as an educator.
* Competitive benefits and premium compensation


  

**As an Assistant Teacher, you will:**  

* Partner with other teachers to implement our proprietary curriculum and have the unique opportunity to use our engaging characters to make TLE a fun place for children to learn, play, and grow.
* Maintain quality compliance and health and safety standards throughout the classrooms and programs.
* Collaborate with your peers to create a great working environment and a welcoming and engaging space for children.
* Communicate with parents and families, sharing their child's latest adventures and achievements through various avenues, including mobile apps and personal discussions.


  

**Do You:**  

  

* Have a genuine passion for the education and care of children?
* Have a high school diploma/GED (ECE coursework preferred)?
* Meet any applicable state licensing requirements for the role?

  

If this sounds like the perfect fit for you, **Apply Now** to learn more about joining our friendly and supportive team.  

  

**Assistant Preschool Teacher Benefits**  

  

* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Employee discount
* Professional development assistance

 There are *applicable state licensing requirements for the role.*  

  

*This franchise is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment at this franchisee should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to The Learning Experience Corporate.*

description:
*Open early, Daily Provisions offers our take on classic bakery items prepared each morning, including signature crullers, homemade baked goods, breakfast sandwiches, and freshly brewed coffee and teas. Throughout the afternoon and evening, Daily Provisions serves made-to-order sandwiches, salads, and seasonal sides, in addition to comforting dishes like our slow-roasted Roast Chicken (best served alongside our selection of cocktails, wine, and beer).*


**Who you are:**As a Back of House Team Member, you have a strong passion for food, technique, and an eagerness to learn more, which comes with the opportunity to build on your skills and grow as a leader in the kitchen. The ideal candidate is friendly, curious, and devoted to becoming an integral member of a team that values hard work and attention to every detail.


**What you’ll do:**


* Responsible for all aspects of kitchen operations, including preparation, cooking, and portioning of food.
* Maintains and properly uses all kitchen equipment including fryers, blenders, food processors, mixers and rotisserie.
* Consistently ensures that prep duties are excellently prepped, seasoned and cooked to the standards taught by Daily Provisions culinary leaders by the designated time of completion.
* Follows standard operating procedures of all recipes, techniques, and builds sheets of assigned dishes as taught by culinary leaders.
* Responsible for correct product storage of all mise en place, including labeling and dating procedures.

* Supports the team (Hospitality and Kitchen) whenever needed (e.g, call-outs, catering, etc.)

* Ability to walk or stand for long periods of time

title: Corporate Associate (Debt Finance) | New York , NY
description:
**Buzz About Us:**

Welcome to Hunt Hive Talent Recruiting Agency, where were all about connecting amazing talent with fantastic opportunities! Our mission? To help businesses and professionals soar to new heights. If you're ready for an adventure in the world of **Debt Finance**, look no further. Join our vibrant team and be part of something extraordinary!

**About the Role:**

Were on the hunt for a **Debt Finance Associate** with **4+ years of experience** to join our clients corporate practice in **New York**. The ideal candidate will have a comprehensive understanding of **debt financing**, including senior secured lending, mezzanine financing, acquisition financing, asset-based financing, and venture debt. If you have **private equity sponsor** experience and are looking to provide high-level legal services in a fast-paced environment, we want to meet you!

**AM Law 100 Requirement:**

To be considered for this role, candidates must have recently worked at one of the **AM Law 100 firms**. To verify if your firm qualifies, please check this **AM Law 100 list**. Only candidates who have worked at these top firms will be considered for this opportunity.

**Your Mission:**

* Handle **senior secured lending, mezzanine financing, acquisition financing, asset-based financing**, and **venture debt** transactions.
* Negotiate and draft **intercreditor agreements** and manage relationships between lenders and borrowers.
* Provide legal advice and counsel on **private equity sponsor** deals from both the borrower and lender perspectives.
* Collaborate with **cross-functional teams** to ensure seamless execution of debt finance deals.
* Manage multiple transactions in a fast-paced environment while balancing client needs and business goals.

**Core Competencies:**

* **Debt Finance Expertise**: Strong experience handling various forms of debt financing, including senior secured lending, mezzanine financing, and acquisition financing.
* **Private Equity Experience**: Experience working with private equity sponsors, either from the borrower or lender side, is essential.
* **Client Service Excellence**: Ability to work closely with demanding clients while maintaining professionalism and delivering top-tier legal service.
* **Communication & Collaboration**: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to work effectively in team settings.

**What You Bring:**

* **Juris Doctor (JD) or LLM** from an ABA-accredited law school.
* Admitted or eligible for admission in **New York**.
* **4+ years of debt finance** and **private equity experience**.
* Strong organizational skills with **attention to detail**.
* Ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and balance competing responsibilities.
* Ability to collaborate effectively in **team settings**.

**Work Environment & Benefits:**

* **Competitive salary** ranging from **$310,000 to $365,000**, plus **bonus eligibility**.
* Comprehensive **health, dental, and vision insurance**.
* **401(k) matching** contributions.
* **Hybrid work environment**: Work from the office approximately **60% of the time** in accordance with firm guidelines.
* **Opportunities for career advancement** and continued professional development.

**Additional Requirements:**

* Must be a United States citizen or authorized to work in the United States.
* Must have a **service-oriented mindset** and the ability to prioritize tasks.

**Why Join Us?**

This is an exciting opportunity to work on **high-level debt finance transactions**, advising clients on complex lending and financing deals. Enjoy **competitive compensation**, **career growth opportunities**, and a **supportive, collaborative work environment** that values professional development.

**Ready to Join the Hive?**

Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Apply now by visiting our website at **www.hunthivetalent.com** and submit your application. We can't wait to hear from you!
