title: Tunnel Inspection Assistant Team Leader
description:
**Job Summary**  
**GMS** is seeking a **Tunnel Inspection Team Leader** for our New York Office. The applicant should have proven effectiveness performing tunnel and/or bridge condition assessments. Strong knowledge of bridge and/or tunnel inspection standards and field inspection experience is essential. This position is full-time and will be in-person in the office (and inspection sites) five days per week.

**Roles & Responsibilities**

Tunnel Inspection Team Leader responsibilities include:

* Perform structural condition inspections of existing Tunnel structures and associated tunnel facility structures in accordance with TOMIE (Tunnel Operations, Maintenance, Inspection, and Evaluation) manual chapters 4 and 5, as well as current ACI and/or AISC standards as applicable.
* Prepare clear and concise inspection reports, for submission to government agencies, including recommendations for repair/rehabilitation
* Lead inspection teams; train and supervise assistant team leaders.
* Coordinate and schedule field activity associated with inspections, including coordination with facility owner/agency and third-party contractors.
* This role requires mandatory random drug/alcohol testing.

**Education and Experience Requirements/Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s or master’s degree from an accredited engineering program
* At least five (5) years of consistent experience in the field of structural engineering and construction
* Registered Professional Engineer in New York, preferred
* Certified as a Team Leader in accordance with the National Tunnel Inspection Standards, 23 CFR Part 650, § 650.509 (b) or shall become certified as a Team Leader by successfully completing the FHWA-NHI-130110 Tunnel Safety Inspection training course Tunnel or bridge condition inspection experience with the ability to identify and evaluate defects that diminish the integrity of a structural member
* Design experience and familiarity with the type of civil/structural systems installed in tunnels
* Ability to assess the degree of deterioration for concrete, steel, masonry, and timber materials
* Understanding of the applicable codes and guidelines for structural systems.

**Talent/Skills**

The ideal candidate should have a solid understanding of construction materials, structural systems, and inspection procedures. They must be familiar with building codes and safety regulations, ensuring that all inspections meet industry standards. Excellent attention to detail and strong observational skills are crucial for identifying structural issues. Effective communication is essential for reporting findings and working collaboratively with project teams. The candidate should be able to work independently on-site and manage time efficiently. Proficiency with inspection tools, testing equipment, and software for report documentation is also required.

**About GMS**

GMS is a multi-disciplinary, Structural Engineering and Architecture consulting firm headquartered in New York City, with offices in Los Angeles, California, New Jersey, and Connecticut. We take great pride in our expertise – please visit our website to see what we do. Since our inception in 1991, GMS has won over 400 project awards and has had the privilege of working with many talented engineers and architects, including ten Pritzker Prize winners. GMS has won four (4) AISC Ideas2 awards and has been a national finalist four times for design of innovative steel projects.

Join our team! Celebrating 33 years of service, GMS is proud to have won hundreds of awards and honored to have collaborated with a wide array of excellent architects, owners, builders, corporations, designers, and artists, including ten Pritzker prize laureates on twenty-four different projects and studies.

We believe that providing a work environment grounded in excellence for our employees will translate directly into outstanding service for our Clients and the other members of the design/construction community.

GMS offers a competitive salary, a comprehensive benefits program, and a 401K retirement plan with a company match. GMS is an equal opportunity employer.

Resumes and transcripts may be sent to employment@gmsllp.com with the job title in the subject line.

PhlebX is a leading technology platform for mobile phlebotomy services.

All our Phlebotomists are equipped with a portable printer for computerized bar code test label printing. Being an advanced technology platform that streamlines your daily work process we are able to help you to get more jobs done!

title: Education Specialist
description:
EcoRise mobilizes a new generation of leaders to design healthy, just, and thriving communities for all. We work at the intersection of sustainability education, climate resilience, and environmental justice by elevating youth voices and advancing student-led solutions to real-world challenges. We offer a range of curricula and programs for students, teachers, school districts, and partners, designed to advance environmental literacy, sustainable schools, and equitable access to green career pathways. EcoRise seeks an experienced educator to join our dynamic, fast-paced team of change-makers.  

  

EcoRise seeks a self-motivated, highly organized, adaptable, and innovative individual with K-12 classroom-based experience for the contract position of Education Specialist. The Education Specialist will support our Regional Program Manager to grow our teacher-facing programs in New York City. The Education Specialist will be responsible for teacher outreach and engagement, customized instructional support, professional development design and facilitation, and supporting the administration of Eco-Audit Grants to support student-designed sustainability projects and showcases. **The Education Specialist will report to the Regional Program Manager and must be based in the New York City metro area.**  

  

**Primary Responsibilities**  

* Organize and facilitate leading-edge professional development through customized, face-to-face, and virtual workshops.
* Connect with teachers via email, video calls, and in-person visits to support the implementation of EcoRise lessons and resources.
* Create teacher resources to increase implementation, including standards-alignment guides, action plans, sample calendars, and how-to videos.
* Support teachers in applying for Eco-Audit Grants, both virtually and in-person.
* Support Program Manager to review student applications, provide feedback, and fund student-designed sustainability projects.
* Assist Program Manager in hosting virtual and in-person Student Innovation Showcases to connect students with green professional volunteers.
* Participate in and support community events relating to sustainability education and environmental justice to strengthen partnerships that increase the efficacy and impact of our collective mission.
* Capture stories - using photography, video, and text - of EcoRise teachers, students, and schools and share with Communications Team for distribution via social media, blogs, impact reports, and monthly newsletters.
* Leverage technology tools and applications such as Canvas, Salesforce, Google Suites, Dropbox, and Trello to manage projects and data effectively.

**Requirements**  

* 3+ years of teaching experience in a K-12 classroom; experience supporting instructional pedagogy and sustainability education is preferred.
* Experience designing and facilitating teacher professional development.
* Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills that help represent and reach racially, culturally, and socioeconomically diverse communities.
* Ability to successfully execute multiple, simultaneous projects on time with high-quality results.
* Attentive to details with a keen aptitude for organization.
* Strong computer literacy skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Google Apps.
* Ability to travel within New York City and work occasional nights and weekends.
* Ability to adapt and learn quickly, ask thoughtful questions, and give and receive feedback.
* Committed to, knowledgeable of, and enthusiastic about the EcoRise mission and programs; familiarity with sustainability, environmental and climate justice, and public K–12 education systems.
* Fluency with Next Generation Science Standards, Common Core State Standards, and/or Cloud Institute’s Education for Sustainability Benchmarks.
* Experience working with New York City Public Schools or within the 5 boroughs.

  

**Timeline and Compensation**  

The project is expected to take 15-20 hours per week, from September 2024 through July 2025 with the possibility of an extension and/or full-time employment. Hourly rate is $35 an hour.  

  

*EcoRise is committed to building a culturally diverse team and strongly encourages applications from Black, Indigenous, and People of Color.*  

  

*The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and technical skills required of personnel so classified.*  

Flexible work from home options available.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate - Global Health Program
description:
The interdisciplinary Global Health Program, administered by the Princeton School of Public and International Affairs, invites outstanding researchers to apply for appointments as Postdoctoral or more senior Research Associates. The Postdoctoral Research Associates will collaborate on the academic activities of the Global Health Program, in addition to conducting their own original research. Responsibilities will include providing guidance, advising and leading methodological workshops on students' independent research projects. The Postdoctoral Research Associates may be invited to teach in one of Princeton's undergraduate programs. Any teaching is contingent on sufficient enrollments and must be approved by the Office of the Dean of the Faculty.
The term of appointment is based on rank. Positions at the postdoctoral rank are for one year with the possibility of renewal pending satisfactory performance and continued funding; those hired at more senior ranks may have multi-year appointments. Anticipated start date is August 1, 2025. Selected candidates will be required to be in residence in Princeton or the local vicinity, or demonstrate to the program's satisfaction the ability to be on campus on a daily basis and on short notice in order to fulfill responsibilities relating to in-person participation.
We seek candidates committed to interdisciplinary research in global health, who innovate methodologically and who demonstrate strong commitment to undergraduate teaching. Candidates who are working in various social science or natural science disciplines will be considered.
Applicable social science fields include but are not limited to: public policy, anthropology, political science, public health, demography, economics, sociology, global health, political science, social determinants of health.
Applicable natural science fields include but are not limited to: epidemiology, disease ecology, environmental health, biostatistics, vaccination.
Applicants are required to hold a Ph.D. or expect to receive a Ph.D. degree by the anticipated start date of the appointment. Applicants must have no more than two years of postdoctoral work experience prior to the start of the appointment.
Applicants must apply online at https://www.princeton.edu/acad-positions/position/36561 and submit a cover letter (indicating relevant qualifications and plans for research and writing), a curriculum vitae, one writing sample and contact information for two references. Referees will be contacted by email with instructions on how to submit a recommendation letter.
The deadline for submission is December 8, 2024 at 11:59 p.m. EST. Applicants will be notified of the outcome of their applications in March 2025.
For more information about the Global Health Program, please visit its website at https://globalhealth.princeton.edu
This position is subject to the University's background check policy. The work location for this position is in-person on campus at Princeton University.
The Princeton School of Public and International Affairs is especially interested in candidates who, through their research, teaching and service, will contribute to the diversity and excellence of the academic community. We actively seek colleagues of exceptional ability who represent a broad range of viewpoints, experience and value systems and who share Princeton University's dedication to excellence and service.
Princeton University is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
company_description: Princeton University is a vibrant community of scholarship and learning that stands in the nation's service and the service of humanity.

title: Strength and Conditioning Coach
description:
**About us**

Elite Per4mance is a small business in Long Island City, NY. We are rewarding, professional, collaborative and our goal is to About Elite Performance Hiring (EP4): Starting as a humble grassroots initiative, Elite Performance Hiring (EP4) has meticulously built a legacy of excellence and dedication in the world of sports performance training. Founded with a mission to radically enhance and refine the approach to baseball training, EP4 has transformed from its embryonic stage to a powerhouse that is reshaping the athletic landscape in New York. Our story begins with a relentless pursuit of perfection and an unyielding commitment to delivering outstanding results. It’s through this lens of tenacity and ambition that EP4 has grown exponentially, not merely by numbers but through influence and impact. We are a testimony to what is possible when passion meets precision, and intention meets innovation. EP4 Training Facility: Situated in the bustling and vibrant Long Island City, the EP4 Training Facility stands as a beacon of our growth and the tangible manifestation of our achievements. It isn't just a structure but a crucible where potential is transformed into unparalleled performance. This state-of-the-art facility is designed not just to meet but to anticipate and exceed the unique needs of every athlete that walks through its doors. Our Pride - Our Results: At EP4, we measure our success by the strides our athletes make. The results produced at our facility are not just numbers; they are the echo of our efficacy and the imprint of our philosophy. With each athlete that surpasses their limits, we see the fruition of our methodologies and approaches, which are ceaselessly refined and recalibrated for excellence. Join the Legacy: As we continue to write our story, we open our doors to individuals ready to be a part of a legacy of triumph and transformation. EP4 isn't just about training; it's about being part of a movement that redefines the contours of baseball training, where every swing, every throw, and every game is a testament to the power of dedicated training and an indomitable spirit. At EP4, you're not just an employee; you're a contributor to a canvas of change and innovation in the realm of sports performance training. Together, let’s continue to set unparalleled standards and craft a narrative of success that inspires and resonates across the field and beyond. Feel free to modify this company description to better fit the unique characteristics and journey of Elite Performance Hiring (EP4)!.

Our work environment includes:

* Growth opportunities
* Relaxed atmosphere
* On-the-job training

**Job Description:**

Elite Performance Hiring is seeking a dedicated and knowledgeable **Strength Coach** to join our dynamic team. With a proven track record of delivering unparalleled results in the baseball sphere, we are on a trajectory that is revolutionizing the way the game is played and experienced. We are committed to not just being a part of the game but transforming it.

**Responsibilities:**

* Design and implement strength and conditioning programs that are tailored to individual athlete's needs and goals.
* Conduct performance testing and use data to evaluate and track athletes’ progress.
* Collaborate closely with our team of experienced coaches and medical professionals to ensure comprehensive athlete care and development.
* Provide education and resources to athletes regarding nutrition, recovery techniques, and overall health and wellness.
* Monitor and adjust training programs as necessary to ensure maximum athlete development and safety.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Exercise Science, Kinesiology, or related field.
* Certification from Cressey Sports Performance or Tread Athletics is strongly preferred. Candidates without these specific certifications but with significant experience in strength and conditioning will also be considered.
* A minimum of 2 years of experience working with baseball athletes.
* Strong understanding of the physiological and biomechanical principles of baseball.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends.

**Qualifications:**

* Graduates from recognized colleges or universities.
* Demonstrated ability to develop and foster relationships with athletes.
* Commitment to continuing education and professional development.

title: Supervising Court Aide
company: The New York State Unified Court System
description:
The New York State Unified Court System is seeking applicants for Supervising Court Aide to assist the Records and Court Operations Department in the Kings County Surrogate's Court.

Under general supervision, Supervising Court Aides are responsible for supervising all Court Aides in a court or agency having a minimum of 3 such positions, and for coordinating the transportation of bulk objects, files, and equipment. Supervising Court Aides supervise the preservation of court records including maintaining complete case files, binding documents, microfilming case papers, and recording information on supplemental index records. Supervising Court Aides also perform messenger duties and a variety of clerical and other related tasks.

**ASSIGNMENT:** This position is assigned to the Record room and Court Operations. Duties include but are not limited to: supervising and providing guidance to support staff as needed; training staff on records management policies and procedures, including proper record-keeping practices and compliance requirements; assisting in the development and implementation of policies and procedures for the storage and retrieval of records and property; coordinating the secure disposal of records and property in accordance with retention schedules and legal requirements; processing court transcript requests; maintaining and updating records management systems, including electronic databases and physical filing systems; and rearranging office equipment and furnishings. Candidates must have the ability to transport objects that weigh up to fifty pounds.

**QUALIFICATIONS:** One year of service in the Court Aide title; or High school diploma or the equivalent; or An equivalent combination of education and experience.

Trade Finance Letter of Credit Document Checker
SUMMARY:  

The Letter of Credit Document Checker is responsible for the accurate and efficient examination of documents presented under letters of credit. This role requires a thorough understanding of international trade documents, UCP 600 (Uniform Customs and Practice for Documentary Credits), ISBP (International Standard Banking Practice), and other related regulations to ensure compliance and mitigate risks associated with international trade transactions.  

PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBI LITIES:  

* Review and verify documents such as bills of lading, invoices, packing lists, insurance documents, and certificates of origin to ensure compliance with the terms and conditions of the LC, UCP 600, ISBP, and any applicable local laws.
* Identify discrepancies, irregularities, and fraud risks in documents and transactions. Take appropriate actions to mitigate risks in accordance with bank policies and international trade practices.
* Ensure all trade transactions comply with internal policies, international trade regulations, anti-money laundering (AML) standards, and Know Your Customer (KYC) procedures.
* Liaise with clients, issuing banks, advising banks, and other stakeholders to clarify, negotiate, and resolve discrepancies or issues related to documents and LC transactions.
* Prepare and submit reports on document checking activities, discrepancies identified, and actions taken. Provide insights and recommendations for process improvements.
* Stay updated with changes in trade finance regulations, UCP 600, ISBP, and other relevant guidelines. Participate in training and professional development opportunities to enhance job performance.

QUALIFICATIONS:  

* College degree in finance, international business, or a related field.
* 3-5 experience in trade finance, particularly in document checking under letters of credit, is highly preferred.
* Strong knowledge of UCP 600, ISBP, and international trade practices.
* CDCS preferred
* Detail-oriented with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
  

The expected base salary ranges from $65,000 - $90,000. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including relevant skills, training, experience, education, and, where applicable, certifications and licenses obtained. Market and organizational factors are also considered. In addition to salary and a generous employee benefits package, successful candidates are eligible to receive a discretionary bonus. #LI-Hybrid  

Other requirements
Mizuho has in place a hybrid working program, with varying opportunities for remote work depending on the nature of the role, needs of your department, as well as local laws and regulatory obligations. Roles in some of our departments have greater in-office requirements that will be communicated to you as part of the recruitment process.

Mizuho's 60,000 employees worldwide offer comprehensive financial services to clients in 35 countries and 800 offices throughout the Americas, EMEA and Asia. Mizuho Americas is a leading provider of corporate and investment banking services to clients in the US, Canada, and Latin America. Through its acquisition of Greenhill, Mizuho provides M&A, restructuring and private capital advisory capabilities across Americas, Europe and Asia. Mizuho Americas employs approximately 3,500 professionals, and its capabilities span corporate and investment banking, capital markets, equity and fixed income sales & trading, derivatives, FX, custody and research. Visit www.mizuhoamericas.com.
Mizuho Americas offers a competitive total rewards package.

Our steady, strategic growth gives our people at all levels rewarding degrees of responsibility and a richer work experience than a boutique firm or an established giant could offer alone.

title: Liquidity Management – VP (Americas Treasury)
description:

time type
Full time

Summary:
The Treasury Liquidity Management function of Mizuho’s Americas Regional Treasury provides oversight over liquidity and funding risks within the US Operations of Mizuho Financial Group. It is responsible for ensuring compliance with Enhanced Prudential Standards (EPS) liquidity requirements for Foreign Bank Organizations (FBOs). Scope covers the US Branches of Mizuho Bank and a US bank holding company, including subsidiaries such as the broker dealer and derivative trading entities.
You will work within Mizuho Americas Regional Treasury in a Liquidity Management capacity. You are comfortable with interacting with senior management across various legal entities, business lines, and functions.
Responsibilities:* Consolidate subsidiary and branch liquidity data into cohesive presentations for senior management committees, governing bodies, and working groups. Scope includes ALCO, CRO packs, and regulator decks.
* Understand and explain key drivers of change in liquidity stress testing for material US entities.
* Rely upon a working knowledge of FR2052a reporting and LCR / NSFR rules to attribute day over day changes to corresponding balance sheet activity.
* Analyze and attest to data produced by the FR 2052a 6G regulatory reporting team; participate in FR2052a governing body meetings.
* Understand liquidity risk models and assumptions, including implementation of enhancements as needed to address changing regulatory or market environments.
* Assess liquidity impacts of prospective products and businesses as part of the New Product Approval Process.
* Maintain Treasury Liquidity Policies, Standards, and Procedures periodically and as needed. Scope includes Liquidity Stress Assumptions documentation.
* Contribute on projects related to systems transformation and new reporting developments.


Qualifications:* 5 or more years experience in an analytical role in a Treasury department or Liquidity function.
* Understanding of Liquidity risk management concepts, including cash flow forecasting, liquidity stress testing, and analysis of funding sources and uses for both bank and broker dealer entities.
* Working knowledge of FR2052a reporting rules and application, as well as LCR, NSFR.
* Knowledge of key liquidity risk regulations such as Regulation YY - Enhanced Prudential Standards for Foreign Banking Organizations (FBOs).
* Good presentation and communication skills, both written and oral. Ability to communicate effectively on abstract risk management concepts.
* High degree of comfort when working with data and spreadsheets (e.g. pivot tables and vlookups), including VBA, Power BI, SQL, and macros.
* Ability to quickly absorb financial concepts and apply them to real world situations.
* Familiarity with financial statement analysis of banks and financial institutions.
* Bachelor’s degree required; finance or accounting degree preferred.

*The expected base salary ranges from $100,000 - $190,000. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including relevant skills, training, experience, education, and, where applicable, certifications and licenses obtained. Market and organizational factors are also considered. In addition to salary and a generous employee benefits package, successful candidates are eligible to receive a discretionary bonus.*

title: Partner Solutions Manager
description:
**Company Description**  

At NBCUniversal, we believe in the talent of our people. It’s our passion and commitment to excellence that drives NBCU’s vast portfolio of brands to succeed. From broadcast and cable networks, news and sports platforms, to film, world-renowned theme parks and a diverse suite of digital properties, we take pride in all that we do and all that we represent. It’s what makes us uniquely NBCU. Here you can create the extraordinary. Join us.

 **Job Description**  

At NBCUniversal, we believe in the talent of our people. It’s our passion and commitment to excellence that drives NBCU’s vast portfolio of brands to succeed. From broadcast and cable networks, news and sports platforms, to film, world-renowned theme parks and a diverse suite of digital properties, we take pride in all that we do and all that we represent. It’s what makes us uniquely NBCU. Here you can create the extraordinary. Join us.

**ABOUT THE ROLE:**


The Partner Solutions team leads the preparation and readiness workflow for all acquired and originally produced programming for our Direct to Consumer (DTC) portfolio. This is an outward-facing group, serving as one of the first touchpoints for productions and content partners; ensuring a seamless operational experience. Along with working directly with content partners, you’ll also help build the policies and procedures that will guide the creation and display of content in DTC as our library increases in size, complexity and diversity.


The team is hiring a **Partner Solutions Manager** to manage the onboarding process for delivery of DTC content, and their requisite programming assets, related metadata, and artwork. This role will support our SkyShowtime and International propositions.


This is a hands-on role involving close collaboration with both external partners and internal teams across various executive levels. The successful candidate will understand the intricacies of working with TV and film content partners in delivering assets spanning numerous content types, genres (unscripted, scripted, live news and sports, anime), and languages, plus have a general understanding of video encoding and asset preparation. Ability to work across multiple high-profile titles while juggling shifting delivery timelines is a must. Experience with multi-language assets such as captions, subtitles, dubs, audio descriptions and metadata is even better.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Lead external partner communications and onboarding with multiple content providers
* Project manage day-to-day content delivery from receipt to launch
* Manage internal requests and content launch timelines with key stakeholders
* Expand and ideate solutions for efficiencies with the partner delivery process
* Work on cross-functional projects with tech, programming, and executives such as new language or feature requests
* All other duties as assigned

  

**Qualifications**  

* Bachelor’s degree in communication, media, business administration, or a related field; or equivalent professional experience
* Minimum 5+ years of professional experience in streaming media operations; film/TV production experience a plus
* 5+ years of professional experience working with TV/film productions, content delivery, asset management, and metadata
* Proficient understand of the post-production/technical side of media as well as understand and grasp creative/artwork specs
* Proficient understanding of video encoding and asset preparation
* Proven ability to work across multiple high-profile titles while juggling changing priorities and deadlines
* Working knowledge of Airtable & Microsoft Office; including OneDrive, Excel and SharePoint
* Excellent verbal, organizational, and written communication skills

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**

* General understanding of content operations or administration for a streaming service
* Prior experience with multi language assets such as captions, subtitles, dubs, audio descriptions and metadata preferred
* Strong interest in the media industry; experience in the entertainment industry a plus
* Self-starter and open communicator, with ability to adapt in a fast-paced environment
* Exceptional attention to detail and ability to multitask across multiple titles and partners
* Highly motivated, willing to learn new things and ability to offer creative solutions

**Hybrid**: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week.


This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website.

**Salary range:** **$80,000 - $105,000 (bonus eligible)**

 **Additional Information**  

As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision.


NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

title: Optical Scientist
description:
OFS has one of the longest and most respectable corporate lineages in American business, which goes back to Alexander Graham Bell and the invention of the telephone more than a century ago. We have a proven track record of being first in the industry with application specific fibers, optical connectors, ribbon cables, erbium doped fibers, Raman fiber lasers, fiber gratings and more. Our mission is to provide leading optical innovations and solutions by designing, manufacturing and supplying the best optical fibers, fiber cable and components and devices for our customers, with exceptional service that creates value for our shareholders, customers and employees. To do so, we must continue shaping the future of communications by applying the best minds to the challenges our customers will continually face.





We are currently seeking an Optical Scientist to join OFS Labs, our corporate R&D facility located in Somerset NJ. The successful candidate will be part of a team that designs, fabricates, and tests new types of optical fibers for high power fiber lasers, as well as building and testing new fiber laser architectures. This will require the ability to solve technical problems, both independently and as part of a team, in developing new products and new manufacturing processes. Significant aspects of the position include conducting experiments; analyzing data; design and control of equipment; and troubleshooting both R&D and manufacturing equipment. It is expected there will be opportunities to contribute to other programs of interest to OFS including optical fiber-based sensors, and optical communication.





In this role, the candidate will support programs on new and improved optical fiber for fiber lasers for specialty markets. This role has the potential to lead an independent research program.





Essential duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:


* Design, execution and analysis of experiments to improve the performance of optical fibers for fiber lasers and amplifiers
* Work with the optical fiber fabrication team and provide input on improved fiber designs and compositions
* Interface with teams developing fiber laser components such as pump-signal fibers, fiber Bragg gratings, and fiber coatings to ensure complete design solutions for fiber laser systems
* Characterize glass, fibers, and coatings and analyze experimental data
* Assist in establishing and executing an R&D program to support OFS manufacturing sites, including a long-term technology roadmap
* Provide technical support to marketing and sales team and assist in understanding new business opportunities
* Perform other related duties as required by management


Key qualifications include:





* Advanced degree (MS or PhD) in Optics, Physics, Electrical Engineering, or related field
* Expertise in optical sciences, waveguide photonics, and related disciplines
* Experience in building, characterizing, simulating and performing data analysis on lasers, preferably fiber lasers, is highly desired
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, preferably as demonstrated by past publications or presentations
* Demonstrated laboratory experience working with optical components and optical fibers
* Coursework and/or research experience in photonics and optics, preferably optical fibers
* Demonstrated problem solving ability in a laboratory environment
* Demonstrated skills in data analysis and lab automation through computer programming with Matlab, Labview, Python, or similar
* Ability to understand and perform optical simulations
* Demonstrate effective communications (verbal, written) skills
* Proficient with MS Office Word and Excel
* Maintain discretion when working with confidential and proprietary information
* Strict adherence to Company safety policies and procedures
* Conform to all aspects of OFS' “Standards of Conduct” document


Working at OFS means having the opportunity to realize ideas, experience innovation and discover new solutions for the future. In addition to our dynamic work environment, we offer competitive salaries and generous benefits programs, including medical, dental, tuition reimbursement and a matching 401(k) plan.





Employees are expected to serve as role models for safe work practices and behaviors. This includes following established health and safety policies and procedures, maintaining a clean, organized work area, wearing, and properly storing all personal protective equipment (PPE), and actively engaging as a safety conscious worker with personal safety and wellness as a priority.



If you'd like to be part of an energetic, world leader in optic fiber solutions, please apply online at www.ofsoptics.com/careers. *Submissions must include salary information.*


***Note:*** Only those candidates selected for the interview process will be contacted.


OFS, a Georgia based global company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or status as an individual with a disability.

title: Personal Banker
description:
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
* Responsible for providing exceptional customer service in accordance with Valley's mission statement. Ability to engage customers with friendly and professional service.
* Knowledge of all Bank products and services and ability to educate and demonstrate customers on such, as well as cross sell various products and services.
* Ability to present a confident and professional demeanor to establish trust and gain knowledge from the customer. Analyze needs and recommend appropriate products and services.
* Meets with customers to analyze financial needs and maximize sales opportunities. Offers all bank products and assists with other service needs, opens new accounts, i.e., checking, savings, certificate of deposit and IRAs, discusses/sells loan products to existing and prospective customers and possesses knowledge of on-line banking and mobile banking abilities to promote and demonstrate to customers.
* Responsible for meeting customer expectations and achieving service quality standards. Participates/oversees the sales referral process ensuring customer financial needs are met and assists management in coaching and mentoring branch staff members.
* Ability to perform all transactions required by a customer and use appropriate technology to provide services most effectively and efficiently. Maintain and balance a cash box. Ability to utilize technology such as Teller Scanning Equipment, Cash Recycling and Cash Dispensing machines and support customers in the use of Coin Machines.
* Act as Vault Teller ensuring adequacy of Branch cash for daily transactions by assisting the branch staff in ordering and shipping currency - coin and controlling - distributing cash to Tellers in prescribed limits.
* Assists in community events (i.e., Habitat for Humanity) etc. Participates in and supports CRA initiatives, activities and programs.
* Report all significant matters, issues and unusual customer activity to Manager maintaining personal knowledge of compliance and regulatory requirements.
* Maintains knowledge and compliance with the Bank's Code of Conduct and all policies and procedures.

Requirements:
**Required Skills:**
* Excellent verbal and written communication. Ability to write correspondence and appropriately and accurately demonstrate products and services to customers.
* Excellent interpersonal - customer service skills, attentiveness, information retention, tact and diplomacy in dealing with both customers and employees.
* Strong analytical, problem solving, and decision-making skills to effectively uncover and resolve complex customer issues.
* Ability to make sound decisions which include making on-the-spot decisions regarding customer transactions; weighing customer satisfaction issues with the Bank exposure to loss or fraud and the ability to think through and rationalize decisions.
* Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram or scheduled form.
* Provides deep understanding of Retail Banking and strong Customer Service Skills with the ability to engage customers in conversation regarding products and services.
* Detail oriented, strong organizational skills, and high degree of accuracy.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Proficient computer skills.

**Required Experience:**
* High School diploma or GED and minimum 1 year of business services experience in branch banking and knowledge of branch operations or successful completion of a Valley Retail training program.
* Associates or Bachelor's degree with concentration in accounting, business, finance, economics or a related field is preferred.

**Preferred Experience:**
* FIS/IBS (Integrated Banking Solutions).
company_description: If you think working in banking can’t be exciting, think again. The financial industry is undergoing a digital transformation, which makes this a great time to embark on a career at Valley.

title: Credit Risk Analyst
description:
Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
* Maintains oversight via internal reporting and dashboards of all ongoing portfolio monitoring requirements and client deliverables as well as compliance with all terms of the loan agreement including (i) financial reporting, (ii) covenant compliance, (iii) collateral monitoring, (iv) required third party reports, (v) annual reviews, and (vi) maturing loans and lines of credit. In coordination with the business team, coordinates client follow up as needed for account monitoring and administration.
* Validates and analyzes reports such as financial statements, borrowing base certificates, collateral field examinations, appraisals, engineering reports, etc. to verify compliance. Completes financial statement spreads and cash flow analysis, performs collateral analysis, and conducts research on industries/markets. Escalates issues to appropriate levels and develops action plans as necessary.
* Ensures credits are accurately risk rated and are properly monitored and reported.
* Collaborates on preparation of all required quarterly reports and analysis including Criticized Loan Monitoring Reports as well as other portfolio management reports as required.
* Underwrites new prospective transactions as well as renewals, extensions, increases, and material modifications and amendments for existing clients.
* Participates in external client meetings as well as internal deal team discussions and approval discussions with senior management.
* Performs the required due diligence and analysis, produces the credit presentation in accordance with guidelines and policy while ensuring timely completion of the underwriting, and presents credit requests to the required level of credit authority.
* Participates in special projects and requests related to the management of the portfolio.
Requirements:
**Required Skills:**
* Knowledge of credit underwriting, financial accounting and loan documentation.
* Knowledge of how a deal should be structured and comfortability with conversing this structure to lenders.
* Proficient computer skills using Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.
* Strong level of interpersonal and social skills needed to interact with loan officers, administrative staff and customers.
* Ability to manage time efficiently.
* Strong mathematical skills.
* Proficient credit skills.
* Strong administrative skills.
* Ability to write reports and business correspondence.
* Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions.

**Required Experience:**
* High School diploma or GED.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in a commercial lending environment in a credit-oriented and underwriting position.

**Preferred Experience:**
* Bachelor's degree and completion of a formal credit training program.

title: Scheduler
description:
Techno Consult, Inc. (**Techno**) is a leading Engineering and Construction Management firm, certified as a Minority Business Enterprise (MBE) and Disadvantaged Business Enterprise (DBE) since 2001. With expertise in various sectors including water/wastewater treatment, mass transit, transportation, and infrastructure, we serve prestigious clients like the NYCDEP and PANYNJ. Our team is dedicated to ensuring Total Quality Management (TQM) for every project, delivering excellence in planning, design, procurement, and execution. We're rapidly expanding, with offices in Princeton, NYC, Massachusetts, Washington, Baltimore, and beyond, actively pursuing CM service opportunities in collaboration with entities like the City of Baltimore DPW, WSSC, and DC Water. Join us as we redefine excellence in engineering and construction management, shaping tomorrow's infrastructure landscape.

Techno is seeking a **Scheduler** to join our project team. In this role, you will develop and manage project schedules, overseeing progress and reporting on project status.

**Job Description:**

* Conduct critical path analysis, resource analysis, and prepare detailed scheduling reports.
* Build and present CPM schedules, performing thorough schedule development and analysis using Primavera P6.
* Serve as a liaison between the project team and the client’s scheduling system to ensure accurate and timely information is conveyed and aligned with the project timeline.
* Oversee the project team’s daily scheduling activities, ensuring performance and productivity meet project goals.
* Identify and manage potential risks and delays, and developing contingency plans to address them.
* Track critical activities and changes to the critical path impacting the project.
* Keep an eye on program milestones and interdependencies.
* Generate reports and update schedules to reflect scope changes or project adjustments.
* Foster strong relationships with project team members, ensuring clear communication and coordination.
* Review and verify scheduling data with project teams to ensure accuracy and feasibility.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field.
* Extensive professional experience in project scheduling.
* Proficiency in Construction Management Software such as Primavera P6, Microsoft Project, and MS Office.
* Ability to consolidate multiple schedule inputs into a master schedule and generate status reports.
* Knowledge of construction processes, sequencing, and project management principles.
* Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to approach challenges creatively.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills.

*Join us as we redefine excellence in engineering and construction management, shaping tomorrow's infrastructure landscape with innovation and precision. As a trusted leader in engineering and construction management, we take immense pride in our role as a driving force within the industry. At Techno, we're not just building projects; we are the visionaries of tomorrow's infrastructure. Join our team and be a part of the transformative journey towards sustainable, resilient, and efficient infrastructure solutions.*

We offer not only a competitive salary but also a robust benefits package including enrollment in our 401(k)-retirement savings plan, comprehensive dental, health, and vision insurance coverage, as well as life insurance. Furthermore, employees are eligible for paid time off and the opportunity to earn bonus incentives.

Techno is an Equal Opportunity Employer dedicated to fostering diversity, equity, and inclusion. We ensure that all applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or disability status. Furthermore, we believe in each person's potential, and we are committed to developing an environment where everyone can thrive. We'll actively support you in realizing your full potential and achieving your goals.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $25.00 - $45.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience:

title: Marketing Manager - Wholesale
description:
Over the last 30 years, Steve Madden and its diffusion brands have expanded into a true lifestyle destination for fashion from head to toe. We are seeking a **Wholesale Marketing Manager** to support wholesale marketing strategy and initiatives for the brands under our umbrella. This role will require creation and implementation of seasonal campaign planning for our retail partners including co-op brand and digital marketing campaigns, in-store lifestyle experience, content development, and management of co-op budgets specific to each.


This role requires a passion for digital marketing, business acumen, the ability to synthesize data while having a nose for good creative, and managing key stakeholders across the business. This person will report to Senior Director, Wholesale Marketing and work within a heavy cross functional matrix.





**Responsibilities to include:**


* Be responsible for the implementation of wholesale marketing strategy across key wholesale partners including advertising campaigns, content marketing, product launches, in-store events, and other key business priorities across wholesale.
* Develop go-to-market plans in collaboration with leadership and wholesale accounts including paid social, digital media, in-store activations, print, sales programs and other marketing activations.
* Ownership of co-op content calendars, creative needs, marketing plans, and innovation, with an “always on” approach to lifestyle marketing for customers
* Collaboration with key accounts teams and digital media/influencer teams to ensure business needs are prioritized and promoted accordingly across all channels
* Seasonal planning for photoshoots in collaboration with accounts, creative, and product teams
* Day to day liaison between Steven Madden, Ltd and retailer marketing teams to ensure collaboration and execution of overall marketing strategy
* Strategic analysis of co-op performance and seasonal presentation to upper management to inform future campaigns
* Manage marketing brief development and project timeline management
* Support the planning and execution of Seasonal Sales Meetings
* Other projects and duties may be assigned


**Requirements:**


* Bachelor's degree in marketing or related discipline, or equivalent professional experience
* 5+ years of marketing experience in field or brand capacity, ideally in footwear or fashion; women's category focus a big ++
* Strong presentation skills along with previous key account management experience
* 1-2 years of experience in ecommerce and paid digital marketing is helpful
* Highly proficient in Excel/Google Sheets and Powerpoint/Google Slides
* Ability to persuade, influence and build consensus among key stakeholders
* You're a self-starter, who is at home with a fast-paced, dynamic, and evolving environment. You have a strong work ethic and have a level of passion for footwear, apparel, and lifestyle
* Strong business acumen
* Travel may be required


*Salary Range: The pay range of this position is $90,000 - $100,000. Actual salary will be determined based off candidate's skill sets, years of experience, and other job-related factors. This range does not include benefits such as health insurance, paid time off, 401K, and additional company benefit*

  

  

Compensation: 90-100K

Industry coverage includes industrials, financial sponsors, consumer and retail, healthcare, financial institutions, energy, and technology, media and telecom. In addition, senior investment banking professionals are expected to "sell the bank" by appropriately positioning the banks treasury and payment solutions product suite as well as floating rate and F/X, private wealth, insurance and other services. Senior investment banking professionals are also expected to serve the bank's corporate banking and commercial clients with strategic advisory and the aforementioned traditional investment banking services in partnership with the primary Commercial and Corporate Banking coverage professionals.**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

5. Strong organizational and leadership skills  

6. Advanced skills in written and oral communications, and interpersonal relationship management  

7. Solid analytical and sales skills

 **Preferred Qualifications**

2. 6+ years of related work related experience

title: Athletic Trainer/Physician Extender
description:
The Physician Extender's position is responsible for assisting the physicians by taking histories, explaining procedures, explaining pre procedure protocol, measure and fit for durable medical equipment, provide treatment, etc.

The essential job responsibilities include:

1. Takes patient history, including updating current conditions, past surgical procedures, etc. and records the information into the patient’s chart.  
2. Review diagnostic tests, including but not limited to lab work, X-rays, MRIs, CT Scans, etc. and ensure the information is in the patient’s chart.  
3. Assists the patients into the exam/procedure rooms, sets them up for the treatment/procedures.  
4. Ensure any pre-operative testing is completed and reviewed prior to any procedures.  
5. Ensure any pre-certification is obtained prior to the completion of any procedure, treatment or durable medical equipment.  
6. Explains to patients pre-operative or post-operative instructions to patients.  
7. Performs patient education concerning procedures, treatment, durable medical equipment, etc. Answer any questions and address any concerns.  
8. Dispense durable medical equipment ordered by the physician. This shall include taking measurements, placing any orders with the companies and showing/explaining to the patient the proper use.  
9. Assist with any procedures.  
10. Perform patient treatment such as laser, exercises, physical performance tests, etc. under the athletic trainer’s scope.  
11. Communicating with other practitioners concerning the patient’s condition, process, current treatment, etc.  
12. Reviewing all new patients to the practice.  
13. Assisting with any documentation.  
14. Scheduling patients follow up appointments.  
15. Confirm that financial matters have been discussed with the patients.  
16. Assist and support the medical providers in developing new exercise plans to provide the patient with variety and progression.  
17. Develop and deliver home exercise programs to patients under the supervision of the Physicians and Therapists.  
18. Assist as an athletic trainer in the facility regarding other responsibilities as well.  
19. Perform athletic training services at various sporting events and competitions on a per diem basis. Become the athletic trainer for a specific sports team and provide these services according to their schedule.  
20. To assist local schools in providing athletic training services to their various Athletic teams when additional coverage is needed, or their athletic trainer is unavailable.  
21. Participate in all facility processes and services.  
22. Participate in all in-service training programs as requested.  
23. Have a flexible nature, capable of performing one task in the context of multiple tasks to accomplish a goal.  
24. Be mature, pleasant and, possess good communication skills.  
25. Other responsibilities as assigned.

**Job Requirements:**

- A minimum of a bachelor's degree in athletic training, masters degree preferred.

- Experience as an athletic trainer working in medical field, preferably working with a medical physician.

- An active New Jersey Athletic Trainer License

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Orthopedics
* Physical & Rehabilitation Medicine
* Sports Medicine

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

License/Certification:

* CPR Certification (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Township of Monroe, NJ 08831 (Preferred)

title: Director of Creative Operations
description:
Cole Haan's Director of Operations will partner with the VP Brand Design & Retail and will join a team who create global storytelling, experiences and consumer journey that bring our brand to life. The Director will integrate the Production and Creative Operations teams to leverage their collective capacities to define, refine, and employ formal processes to enable, amplify, and deliver the work of the Brand Design studio.
The Director is an experienced creative leader who can set a shared vision and partner with Brand Design and Marketing colleagues to execute the broadest company strategies and the finest of details with equal excellence. The ideal candidate will be both a strategic thinker and technical expert who thrives in a fast-paced environment and will have previous experience executing successful global marketing campaigns. The Senior Director will combine data-driven foresight, iterative development, a sense of the possible with the commitment to the highest quality of deliverables to ensure a positive return on investment and the translation of design into realities that speak to our customers.
**CORE ACCOUNTABILITIES:**
* Drive and manage the Brand Design organization's seasonal planning, partnering across all design, marketing leadership and other cross functional teams to define and document key planning and execution milestones across all disciplines
* Develop and lead core Brand Design and Production initiative, project management practices that establish formal communication that is clear and often, in a timely, organized, and user-friendly manner, providing task status, delivery schedules, open issues, risks, and solution plans to senior leadership. This includes briefing and implementation into projects.
* Recalibrate Brand Design and Production project schedules from inception to completion, including resource planning & management, issues & risk management, monitoring progress, reporting & documentation
* Create, maintain, and sharing out of the full brand marketing seasonal calendar, working across key brand marketing disciplines for creative brief writing, concept development, art direction, design/writing (web, video, print & social / paid media, and store signage for review, approval and delivery of assets to marketing)
* Lead development and rollout of Brand Design practices across the organization; drive continuous process improvement and seek ways to do things better, faster, and more efficiently
* Lead all project management of all external media / channel partner initiatives and creative production operations
* Oversight, development and monthly management of the Brand Design budget, in partnership with Marketing Team leadership and assist with monthly reconciliation process to ensure projects are on time and on budget.
* Own weekly Creative Status meeting and co-own weekly Marketing Status meeting
* Review, develop, implement and document technical and workflow processes within the studio to achieve new refinements
* Lead Brand Design's Studio Management functions
* Proactively research manufacturing methods and materials to consistently elevate our brand expression in retail and other physical experiences
* Demonstrate continuous workflow optimization, leveraging all available software tools

Continually evolve knowledge of workflow best practices within the greater Production space  
* 

  

Requirements:
* BFA/BA required preferably from a top-tier art school or creative major preferred
* Minimum of 10+ years combined experience leading Print Production and Creative Operations/Studio Management within a comparable in-house creative department, design studio, or creative agency. Retail/Fashion industry experience preferred; digital experience required
* Excellent verbal, written and technical communication skills enabling presentation of concepts and ideas
* Excellent understanding of digital design technologies with increasing knowledge of UX and motion
* Working knowledge of color management; on-press color approval experience required
* Expert knowledge of Mac OS X, Google Apps, Microsoft Office, and/or Apple iWork, as well as Adobe Creative Cloud, with proven command of InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator


**Base Salary Range:** $170,000 - 190,000\\* annually + bonus potential
**Bonus Eligibility:** Yes, eligible for annual target bonus based on company and individual performance
**Benefits Offered:** Health Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Care, Health Savings Accounts, 401(k) Retirement Plan, Vacation Time, Sick Time, Paid Parental Leave, Holidays and Cole Haan Discounts
* Rate of pay dependent upon candidates' relevant skills, experience, and location



*This position is not available to be performed in Colorado.*

We have been, and continue to be, committed to Equal Opportunity Employment and equal treatment of all qualified individuals - regardless of race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, disability, or any other factors that are not job related*

title: Creative Director, Brand
description:
Cole Haan's Creative Director will partner with the SVP Marketing and VP Brand Design & Retail to craft the narrative, aesthetic, feel and voice for this iconic American Brand. As a part of Cole Haan's leading global men's and women's footwear and accessories company this position will create best-in-class consumer focused storytelling, design & branding across our portfolio of products for our multigenerational consumer.
The Creative Director will work cross-functionally throughout our product creation process from start to finish to partner on our seasonal narrative direction, brand, product and innovation storytelling to define our seasonal look, feel, voice and execution. In addition, in the role of Creative Director, you will be tasked with building world class creative and production teams focused on ideas not items to create industry leading conceptual design solutions across all communication channels including but not limited to site, UX, e-commerce, brand/social content, paid/social performance media, retail and wholesale.
**CORE ACCOUNTABILITIES:**
* Oversee the design, storytelling, creative direction, and execution of global Multichannel Brand creative strategy in alignment with the Cole Haan consumer across all touchpoints, including brand campaigns
* Partner with Product Creation and Brand Marketing on seasonal strategic creative direction and execution
* Lead, inspire, enable, and energize the Cole Haan Brand Design team, inclusive of designers, copyrighters, asset creation, retail design and creative operations
* Review, critique, and guide work generated by the team and creative agency partners
* Provide thought-leadership in establishing, implementing, and improving direction, goals, and process for the team
* Be a student of consumers: of trends, innovation, technology, retail, competitors and culture.
* Listen, learn and mine insights that direct the brand into amazing places and platforms.
* Hands-on execution of conceptual and expressive brand design across all surfaces and channels for the brand
* Collaborate and co-create with outstanding creative partners. Appoint and direct world-class agencies, freelancers, creative/artistic, producers that elevate the team and the work. Demand only the best. Accept only the best.
* Ensure we lead the competition by pioneering consumer connected work with excellent design skills and taste in graphic design, typography, photography, illustration, layouts, color strategy, 3D, motion, interactive, and spatial and experiential design
* Understand the user experience across multiple channels and surfaces, to provide best-practice critiques and recommendations
* Optimize the way the Cole Haan creative team works across channel and cross-functional partners to meet strategic company and marketing goals
* Demonstrate financial accountability in connection to Brand Concept and execution across multiple channels.
* Create strong partnerships with cross-functional partners inclusive of brand marketing, product design, product marketing, product development, brand & product operations, and sales.
* Drive a culture of teamwork and cross functional collaboration. Ensuring all opportunities and initiatives are integrated and gain maximum exposure externally and internally.
* Create a culture of proactive and open-communication to share brand creative expertise and integrate across the entire business.
* Partner with Marketing Leadership to drive the business. and maximize the best brand practices and opportunities.

Requirements:
* Bachelor's degree in graphic design/communication design, Art and/or Science
* 10+ years of relevant experience in Brand Design, Graphic Design or Agency related experience; preferably with global Brand and/or leading Creative Agency space
* High level of experience and success in managing across a multi-disciplined team of designers and cross-functional partners—must include demonstrated proficiency in driving UX design teams
* High proficiency and leadership experience managing multiple projects/workstreams across multiple timelines
* Extensive experience delivering across multi-channel, large-scale, initiatives, experience driving changes in operational processes and aligning teams to a strategic vision
* Strength in presenting to large audiences, communicating brand concepts and practical applications to brand communications
* Strong knowledge and passion for design, fashion, music, sports, arts, culture, and marketplace trends
* Hands on graphic design skills within traditional (dress/casual) and technical (sport) footwear
* Must have a high degree of proficiency conceptualizing and using all related Macintosh systems and digital design platforms (InDesign, XD, illustrator, Photoshop, Premiere, PowerPoint/Keynote, MIRO)
* Must be proficient in the creation of compelling and professional presentations that represent the ethos and aesthetic of Cole Haan
* Ability to work under deadlines, manage multiple priorities, work independently and collaboratively, take initiative, and pay close attention to detail
* Fluent in English with excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Experience across the full palette of brand expression: website, email, social media, paid media, retail, print, OOH, film, motion, experiential and events
* Experience making operational contributions at both strategic and tactical levels
* Experience developing and optimizing systems, tools, processes and workflows for creative teams
* A link to an online portfolio showcasing your work (include link on your resume)


**Base Salary Range:** $195,000 - 235,000\\* annually + bonus potential
**Bonus Eligibility:** Yes, eligible for annual target bonus based on company and individual performance
**Benefits Offered:** Health Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Care, Health Savings Accounts, 401(k) Retirement Plan, Vacation Time, Sick Time, Paid Parental Leave, Holidays and Cole Haan Discounts
* Rate of pay dependent upon candidates' relevant skills, experience, and location

title: Visiting Research Scholar-Fung Global Fellows Program
description:
Princeton University is pleased to announce the call for applications to the Fung Global Fellows Program at the Princeton Institute for International and Regional Studies (PIIRS). The program will select early-career scholars from around the world to be in residence at Princeton for an academic year (10 months) and to engage in research and discussion around a common theme. The fellowships will be awarded to those employed outside the United States who have a faculty appointment, a professional research appointment, or are established independent scholars. They will also be expected to return to their positions at the conclusion of the fellowship. Lastly, they must have demonstrated outstanding scholarly achievement and unusual intellectual promise. Early-career scholars will be appointed at the rank of Visiting Research Scholar.
The program for the academic year 2025-26 will focus on "Postimperial Spaces of Amnesia." While the current fellows are in conversation investigating the residues of colonialism in diverse parts of Asia, Africa, and Latin America, this next group will expand the conversation to examine the willed amnesia, or yet nostalgia, concerning the imperial past-in former metropoles and colonies alike, where memories of often violent processes of expropriation have frequently been distanced in time and space, erased, or are simply not recalled today. This is despite the continuum of supply and demand straddling the postcolonial moment. One might think, for example, of the global demand for products with plantation antecedents such as coffee and rubber; ongoing issues of migration, mobility and citizenship; or decisions about museums, monuments, and the content of school curricula. Just where and when does the question of the colonial past figure in the modern public sphere as governments make decisions about how to remember (or forget) while movements seek social justice or reparations? What is forgotten when something else is recalled and celebrated? Who decides when the colonial came to an end?
Applicants may address any region of the world that has had a colonial relationship, and may be from any disciplinary background in the humanities and social sciences. Applicants must apply online at https://www.princeton.edu/acad-positions/position/36541. Applications are due on November 15, 2024 (11:59 p.m. EST). To be eligible, applicants must have received their Ph.D. (or equivalent) no earlier than September 1, 2015. Fellowships will be awarded on the strength of a candidate's proposed research project, the relationship of the project to the program's theme, the candidate's scholarly record and ability to contribute to the intellectual life of the program. More information: https://funggfp.princeton.edu/applications.
The following items must be submitted by the applicant, in English, by November 15, 2024:
- Cover letter (1.5 pages maximum)
- Curriculum Vitae (including publications)
- Research proposal (maximum of 3 pages, single spaced)
- One writing sample (article or book chapter, maximum of 50 pages)
- If an applicant is an established independent scholar, please upload a PDF stating this as the applicant's current status.
- The names and email addresses for three referees, who will be contacted automatically by the online application system with an invitation to upload their letter of recommendation to the system by the application deadline. (\\*Please note: all letters of reference should be submitted by your referees before the November 15, 2024 deadline.\\*)
Should an offer be made, successful candidates who hold faculty appointments or professional research appointments, will be required to submit an official letter from their current employer affirming that they would be permitted to accept the offer and to spend the academic year at Princeton University.
The work location for this position is in-person, on campus at Princeton University.

title: Front Desk Associate
description:
Nationwide health and wellness center is seeking a part-time Front Desk Associate.

The Front Desk Coach is responsible for providing customer services through the front service desk with enthusiasm professionalism and efficiency by performing the following duties.

Greets all members and guests in a friendly and pleasant manner with the goal of delivering the highest level of customer service.

Provides information to members, guests and callers regarding club services, events and programs.

Answers all incoming phone calls and promptly responds to the inquiry of the caller, transfers the caller to the appropriate phone number or seeks information from other club sources to answer the caller immediately.

Conducts point of sale transactions including taking cash/making change or credit card payment and enters payment transactions accurately and completely in the club information and point of sale transaction system.

Provides membership tours when assigned; communicates information about the facility and services and completes membership forms according to the procedure established at the club.

Schedules assessments, consultations and other program services in accordance with the club’s scheduling system and policies.

Assists with special event registration and queues entry to the event to assure an orderly and pleasant experience for attendees.

Signs in/out equipment following the club procedure and monitors members exiting the facility for security purposes.

When assigned, opens or closes the club following all club procedures outlined for these activities.

Requirements:

Must be available for early morning shifts. High School Diploma or equivalent required, 1-2 years customer service experience required; or any equivalent combination of education, experience, and training that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.

title: Job Cost Accountant (JCA)
description:
**Position:** Job Cost Accountant (JCA)  

**Reports To:** Owner  

  

**What does a JCA with Paul Davis do?**  

* Manage all phases of job costing within proprietary accounting software and QuickBooks accounting software
* Maintain all accounting, computer and financial records for franchise in conjunction with a CPA
* Monthly WIP adjustments
* Manage A/P, A/R
* Assist in audits and general ledger preparation
* Comply with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) for financial statements

  

**Why Join The Team?** Paul Davis is an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and commercial properties throughout the United States and Canada. We are growing locally and have career opportunities for individuals who want purpose out of their work. We love creating an opportunity for our team members, offering a variety of webinars for the Job Cost Accountant to stay motivated and updated on new technologies, regulations, procedures, etc.  

  

Built upon principles of customer service, dynamic decision-making and leadership, we have the tools to continue our rapid growth. Our team puts emphasis into living our Vision, Mission and Values to be more than just a service provider – our JCA position is pivotal to the success of the franchise.  

  

**Values:** Deliver what you promise. Respect the individual. Have pride in what you do. Practice continuous improvement.  

  

**Vision:** To provide extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need.  

  

**Mission:** To provide opportunities for great people to deliver Best in Class results.  

  

**Why The Team Needs You?** At Paul Davis, we help homeowners put their lives together after a traumatic event. If you can perform in stressful situations, have excellent communication skills, knowledge of accounting, debits and credits, QuickBooks and would enjoy the reward of working in a fast-paced environment, come join us. Everyone within Paul Davis needs to have a world-class work ethic, serious attention to detail and love to help people. The JCA works with owners and the office staff to ensure that all jobs are costed properly, accurately, and follow the guidelines for Job Cost Accountant. You will be practicing continuous improvement every day as you establish rapport with insurance carriers, customers, vendors, subcontractors, adjusters, agents and fellow team members!  

  

**Team Compensation and Benefits:**  

* Paid training
* Health benefits offered
* 401K
* Great culture and team dynamic
* Competitive Salary, Commensurate with experience

  

  

**Team Qualifications (Requirements):**  

* Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, business with an emphasis in accounting, or related field
* 2-3 years of previous accounting, bookkeeping, or related experience
* Experience with Microsoft Office Suite and Quickbooks
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Knowledge of bookkeeping and accounting best practices and GAAP
* Accurate and precise attention to detail
* Ability to multitask, prioritize and manage time efficiently

  

  

**Role on the Team (Job Responsibilities):**  

* Manage all phases of job costing within proprietary accounting software and QuickBooks accounting software
* Monthly WIP adjustments
* Maintain all accounting, computer and financial records for franchise in conjunction with a CPA
* Manage A/P, A/R
* Assist in audits and general ledger preparation
* Manage all phases of job costing
* Verify timesheets and process employee payroll
* Review costs vs budget for subcontractors, vendors and materials

  

  

Please apply if you think you have what it takes to serve others and deliver a world-class service when others need it the most. We are looking forward to discussing this opportunity with you.  

  

**We support and hire Veterans and we are an Equal Opportunity Employer!**  

Flexible work from home options available.
